Subject: Bestek Just checking in
Body:
Bobby,

          Just checking in with you and seeing if there is anything you
might need

for the upcoming season. I hope you are having an enjoyable start to the New
Year.

Please keep us in mind when it comes to rentals of lighting equipment from
simple lighting

units to moving lights and LED's to power distribution for trade shows or
exhibits halls.

Please remember are our staging department does have handicap ramps and half
and full 

circles that can be added to your staging order if needed. 

Also please keep in mind we also rent podiums from Plexi-glass that can put
custom logos to plain oak podiums.

We also have pipe & drapes at 8' 12 & 16' heights.

We are Rosco dealers with expendables like color gels, standard and custom
gobos.

Bestek now has a graphic department with the capability of printing on vinyl
and fabric which you can add to you scenic designs for fashion or corporate
cliental. 

I hope that we all will have a successful upcoming season.  

 

All the best to you for the upcoming season

 

Michael Talbot

Bestek Lighting & Staging

mtalbot@bestek.com

(O) 631-643-0707

(M) 516-547-3271

www.bestek.com

Subject: Fw: The Night LIght
Body:
Subject: FW: The Night LIght

 

   THE NIGHT LIGHT

   

        A 90-year-old man goes for a physical. All of his tests come back with normal results.
       

        The doctor says, "Larry, everything looks great. How are you doing mentally and emotionally? Are you at peace with God?"
       

   

        Larry replies, "God and I are tight. He knows I have poor eyesight, so He's fixed it so when I get up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom, poof! The light goes on. When I'm done, poof! The light goes off."
       

        "Wow, that's incredible," the    doctor says.
       

   

        A little later in the day, the doctor calls Larry's wife. "Bonnie," he says, "Larry is doing fine! But I had to call you because I'm in awe of his relationship with God. Is it true that he gets up during the night, and poof, the light goes on in the bathroom, and               
       

        when he's done, poof, the light goes off?" 
       

   

         "Oh sweet Jesus", exclaims Bonnie. "He's peeing in the refrigerator again!"
Label: IMPORTANT,CATEGORY_PERSONAL,INBOX,UNREAD

Subject: Grumman Stage 3  March 21-25
Body:
Hi Bobby,

We're back.  LOL

Attached is the plan

There are 15 room drops   all listed with a nice plug symbol (all 20 amps)

I need 7 towers. I am shipping you the lights, clamps and Edison plugs to your location (please attach the Edison plugs)

Dan has advised on what I need to light this one. 

Each tower will need to be 15 tall  4 of the fixtures will be lightly focused for general lighting (I have a lift for this one)

Will need a power drop (20 amps) to each with the extension cords and the power strip.

They are painting the floor (since it is in terrible shape) so we can not drive into the facility this time on the in.

I am starting setup at 8am figure you there around 9.

Break is in the 25th at 9pm.

Mark

Subject: A message from Total Productions, Inc.
Body:
Total Productions Inc. is a fully insured company.

 

Daniel Marcy - President & Owner

Total Productions, Inc.  P.O. Box 1034, West Babylon, NY 11704    Mobile:  1
(516) 509-9467

Website:  <http://totalproductionsinc.com> http://totalproductionsinc.com
E-mails:  <mailto:danmarcy62@yahoo.com> danmarcy62@yahoo.com  or
danmarcytpi@gmail.com

 

Please let me introduce myself, my name is Kim Leonardo, I am the Director
of Operations at Total Productions and I have recently joined the TPI team
full time. One of my first tasks assigned was Dan requested for me to reach
out to you to discuss what we can do to recapture your business. We received
valuable feedback from our clients in 2017. Let me tell you about some of
the great improvements we have made in 2018.

 

TPI Improvements

*	Improved Standard Operating Procedures
*	Created a Job Fulfillment Form for both estimates and bookings
*	Enhanced our hiring procedures to capture more highly skilled
freelancers
*	Expanded our freelance database

Questions  

*	What can we do to recapture your business?

*	Do you feel our prices are competitive?
*	Do you feel confident in the TPI freelance staff?

We would really like your opinion based on the questions listed above and
the opportunity to discuss reestablishing our business relationship. 
Please respond via e-mail or if you would prefer I would be happy to set-up
a phone conference.

 

Thank you for your time, hope to talk with you soon,

Kim Leonardo

 

Kim Leonardo - Director of Operations

Total Productions, Inc.

PO Box 1034, West Babylon, NY 11704

Telephone:  1 (516) 662-4469

Website: http://totalproductionsinc.com/ 

E-mail:   <mailto:kimleotpi@gmail.com> kimleotpi@gmail.com

How are things? If you have time for a call...my board president went to an event recently at the parish
Center and loved the lighting. I think he wants to add a little more uplighting but
I'd like to talk to you about it when you have time.

Also, I'd like to extend an invitation to you and a guest (and please feel free to bring Rich Conlon and have him invite a guest as well) to join us that night as an additional thank you.

Thanks!
laurie

Subject: Re: Cinelli/Calvanese Wedding April 21,2018
Body:
Hi MaryEllen,

We met with Bobby at Heritage Club last night.

Please mark calendar and adjust date, as Bobby had wrong event date.

The wedding is on Saturday, April 21.  7 pm start.

We will be using Brilliance Pro for lighting and will be getting ,
Package # 3.

Christina and Joseph (B & G) will be in touch with you to schedule second meeting with Tech to go over details, sign contract and pay balance.  
They need to coordinate with their work schedules and you to get a date that works for all.

Thank you
Gina Cinelli 

> On Feb 23, 2018, at 12:48 PM, Bobby <bob@brilliancepro.com> wrote:
> 
> Hi Gina:  Monday February 26th  6:30 PM at The Heritage Club is confirmed.  We will be meeting you there.  Mary Ellen 
> 
>> On Feb 22, 2018, at 3:17 PM, GNT923 <gnt923@aol.com> wrote:
>> 
>> Hi MaryEllen, 
>> 
>> Just confirming our demo appointment meeting on Monday , Feb 26 at 6:30 pm at Heritage Club.
>> 
>> Thank you, 
>> Gina Cinelli 
>> 
>>> On Feb 12, 2018, at 3:29 PM, Bobby <bob@brilliancepro.com> wrote:
>>> 
>>> Gina:  I spoke with the Heritage Club and I can get in for a demo on Monday February 26th, does 6:00 or 6:30 work for you?  Mary Ellen
>>>> On Feb 9, 2018, at 4:20 PM, Gnt923 <gnt923@aol.com> wrote:
>>>> 
>>>> Thank you Mary Ellen. I appreciate it so much!  Have a great weekend!
>>>> 
>>>> Most sincerely 
>>>> Gina Cinelli 
>>>> 
>>>>> On Feb 9, 2018, at 4:17 PM, Bobby <bob@brilliancepro.com> wrote:
>>>>> 
>>>>> Gina:  I am going to check with The Heritage Club next week.  We cannot get in on Sundays & Mondays and Feb. 27th they also have an event.  I will check and be in 
>>>>> touch next week.  
>>>>> 
>>>>> Mary Ellen
>>>>>> On Feb 9, 2018, at 4:05 PM, Gnt923 <gnt923@aol.com> wrote:
>>>>>> 
>>>>>> Hi MaryEllen
>>>>>> 
>>>>>> Is the Tech available on another evening???  The bride my daughter Christina is a nurse and works night shift. She wants to be there. 
>>>>>> 
>>>>>> She is off Feb25,26,27 or March 4 and 5.  Any of these work for her.  Hopefully you can give us one of these dates.
>>>>>> 
>>>>>> We definitely want a night appt.
>>>>>> All these days work.
>>>>>> 
>>>>>> Thank you
>>>>>> Gina
>>>>>> 
>>>>>>> On Feb 9, 2018, at 3:53 PM, Bobby <bob@brilliancepro.com> wrote:

>>>>>>> Gina:  Lets do March 1st , at 6:15  at The Heritage Club.  Our Tech will meet you there for the Demo.  Mary Ellen

>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>> Hi Mary Ellen, 
>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>> Wednesday Feb 14 or Friday February 16 not good.  Sample Appointments both days  with Pedestals Florist.  
>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>> I can do any other daytime that suits you or Evening March 1, 6:15 is perfect!! 
>>>>>>>> But I would prefer evening at Heritage Club if that’s the plan where we are meeting.
>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>> Thank you
>>>>>>>> Gina 
>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>> On Feb 9, 2018, at 3:39 PM, Bobby <bob@brilliancepro.com> wrote:
>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>> Hi Gina:  If you are available during the day I can do February 14th Wednesday  at 11:45.  If only in the evening I have Thursday March 1st, at 6:15 PM.  Let me know if either one works. 
>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>> Mary Ellen
>>>>>>>>>> On Feb 9, 2018, at 11:27 AM, 'GNT923' via info <info@brilliancepro.com> wrote:
>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>> Hi MaryEllen,
>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>> Just touching base as you told me to contact you late Jan/early Feb  to make an appointment to get together to discuss lighting for our wedding at Heritage Club at Bethpage on Saturday, April 21.
>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>> Please let me know when we can set something up to see effects and discuss so we can get it done and I can put this on the completed listed.  Looking forward to hearing from you.  
>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>> Thank you,
>>>>>>>>>> Gina Cinelli 
>>>>>>>>>> 917-796-7238

Subject: 2018 Music Under the Stars
Body:
We have started booking for this summer's Music Under the Stars!  You will see we are going to be inviting some bands back from last year and trying a few new local bands.   Here's what we have so far:

Tues. July 10 - SALUTE TO AMERICA (No Band Yet) - Burns Park, Massapequa
Wed. July 18 - THE JOHNNY RODGERS SHOW The History of Rock n' Roll Buddy Holly and Beyond - Allen Park, Farmingdale
Thurs. July 19 - BENNY AND THE JETS The Ultimate Elton John Tribute - Theo. Roos. Park, Oyster Bay
Sat. Aug 4 - BONJOURNEY NY - Burns Park, Massapequa
Sat. Aug 11 - LORDS OF 52ND STREET -  Burns Park, Massapequa
More to come in the next few days!
Krista Fileccia
Town of Oyster Bay
Cultural & Performing Arts Division
977 Hicksville Road
Massapequa, NY 11758
Phone (516) 797-7925
Fax (516) 797-7919

Subject: Hammerstein ballroom coordination
Body:
Bob
Great speaking with you today.  As we discussed there is a lot of interest
in the Hammerstein ballroom venue, especially since it has the hotel above
the ballroom.

Here is a basic list of what the Imperial Court is looking for:

Large stage
very important - an area to be used as a dressing room near stage
runway brought in by client  -  goes out around 30 ft x 8 ft wide - has a T
at the end 15 ft x 8 ft
need a good size aria for Chinese auction
catering - dinner and alcohol
seating for 600- 800 people

hotel accommodations for out of town guests

Client wants venue research to be wrapped up by end of March.

NEXT STEP:
Please forward event manager contact info for Hammerstein ball room. I will
send it out to Champ Knecht - the lead venue committee contact for Imperial
Court.

Thanks,
Lou Savarese
631 255-3285 <(631)%20255-3285>
Label: IMPORTANT,CATEGORY_PERSONAL,INBOX,UNREAD

Beth

> Hi Beth:  I just finished working on all the details for your upcoming party this Saturday and I have one question.  Originally you sent me 3 Logos.  Masons Madness I have on the Screen in

> MONTAGE 
> PHOTOLOOP

> 
> Have a Wonderful Day,  Mary Ellen 
> 
>

Subject: 2018 HOG 1797 Winter Newsletter
Body:
Hello Members,

Attached you'll find the Winter 2018 newsletter.

Sunday, March 11th at 9:00 am is our next Chapter Meeting.
Levittown VFW 55 Hickory Lane, Levittown, New York 11756.
Bagels, Rolls, Coffee, Tea and O.J.
$5.00 PP collected at the door, includes you in a raffle for
Dealer Gift Certificates donated by our sponsoring dealer, H-D of Nassau County.

We want your chapter pix for our newsletter. We welcome and encourage personal riding photos (short stories too) from events or vacations outside of our chapter. Sharing an adventure inspires others! Please send your pictures/stories/ideas to our editor, Anne Leone (macktsbabe@gmail.com <mailto:macktsbabe@gmail.com>)

Thanks, and ride safe!

John Vezzi
Secretary

Digital Signatures

Gigbuilder has the ability to allow your prospects to digitally sign their contracts. Unlike other event management software on the market that will only allow your prospect to follow a link in an email, Gigbuilder goes a step beyond. Gigbuilder allows the same procedure with emails but also allows your prospect to sign their contract from within their online event planner. Your prospect can make an immediate payment as well if allowed. Plus, Gigbuilder can send you an SMS/text message when the contract is signed.

Get some FREE publicity FAST and EASY

Visit WeDJ.com and navigate to pages where you want your business to show up and make comments in the Facebook widget then visit your profile page and do the same. Make sure to click to post on Facebook too and you'll get a free inbound link to your profile from Facebook!!

Subject: Quick Question
Body:
Hey Bobby,

As you may know we had a fire a few years back at one of our Community Centers. Renovations have been completed and we are almost ready to reopen the North Albany Community to residents.  However, we are in the process of finding a company that we can purchase a sound system from.  I don't know all of the details but I believe this company would also install the sound system.  Joe Visconti asked that I reach out to you regarding this for two reasons, does Brilliance do that kind of work or do you know any companies that do sound system installations?   As you know we at the town have to go through a bidding process, and Joe will have more details on the specifics.

Thanks,

Krista Fileccia
Town of Oyster Bay
Cultural & Performing Arts Division
977 Hicksville Road
Massapequa, NY 11758
Phone (516) 797-7925
Fax (516) 797-7919

Subject: Zero Tolerance - Executive Order 2-2018
Body:
Dear Nassau County Vendor:

Please be advised that effective immediately, pursuant to Executive Order 2-2018 (the "Executive Order"), Nassau County (the "County") has implemented a zero-tolerance policy regarding gifts to or from anyone that does business with or is likely in the future to do business with the County, including, but not limited to, tenants, vendors, concessionaires, and their representatives or representative associations ("County Vendor").  The policy is as follows:

In accordance with the Executive Order, a County Vendor shall not offer, give, or agree to give anything of value to any County employee, agent, consultant, construction manager, or other person or firm representing the County (a "County Representative"), including members of a County Representativeâs immediate family, in connection with the performance by such County Representative of duties involving transactions with the County Vendor on behalf of the County.  Additionally, a County Vendor is prohibited from accepting any gifts, gratuities, or payments of any kind, form, or value from any County Representative, including members of a County Representativeâs immediate family, in connection with the performance by such County Representative of duties involving transactions with the County Vendor on behalf of the County. 

As used herein, "anything of value" or "any kind, form, or value" shall include, but not be limited to, meals, holiday gifts, holiday baskets, gift cards, tickets to golf outings, tickets to sporting events, currency of any kind, cash discounts not available to all County employees, or any other gifts, gratuities, favorable opportunities or preferences.  As used herein, "members of a County Representativeâs immediate family" shall include a spouse, child, parent, or sibling.  This policy also applies to subcontractors of County Vendors that have been engaged under any County contract.

Furthermore, a County Vendor that is required to complete any contract disclosure form(s) in response to a County solicitation or as part of a County contract submission (a "Disclosure Form") shall disclose in the conflicts of interest section of the Disclosure Form any and all instances where the County Vendor employs any spouse, child, or parent of a County employee of the agency or department that contracted or procured the goods or services.  The County Vendor has a continuing obligation, as circumstances arise, to update the Disclosure Form throughout the term of any County contract awarded to the County Vendor.

If you become aware of any violation of this policy, it must be reported immediately to the County Confidential Hotline at (516) 571-STOP. 

If you have any questions, please contact (516) 571-6101.

Sincerely,

John B. Chiara
Deputy County Executive for Compliance
Office of the Nassau County Executive
1550 Franklin Ave
Mineola, New York 11501
(516) 571-6101

Body:

Sent via the Samsung Galaxy S7 edge, an AT&T 4G LTE smartphone
-------- Original message --------From: Bobby <bob@brilliancepro.com> Date: 3/12/18  1:32 PM  (GMT-05:00) To: Odalys Montpeirous <odalys.monty@gmail.com> Subject: Re: 4/7/2018 
Odalys:  Unfortunately our techs are booked on the 28th.  Is there any way we could meet at CATP on March 29th?  Mary Ellen				
On Mar 12, 2018, at 10:11 AM, Bobby <Bob@brilliancepro.com> wrote:
Odalys:  I will be in touch in regard to the appt on March 28th.  Package 2 does not include video, only Package 3 and 4.  As far as format you can send me the video in a MP4  and the  photos in a jpeg.  Hope this helps.  Mary Ellen
On Mar 9, 2018, at 12:45 PM, Odalys Montpeirous <odalys.monty@gmail.com> wrote:
Ok. Can we do March 28 at 3 p.m. at Carlyle? I can give the check on that day. Does package 2 allow us to play videos? What is the appropriate format to get you the videos and photos?
On Fri, Mar 9, 2018 at 12:39 PM, Bobby <bob@brilliancepro.com> wrote:
Yes it is better to have as much Video Content as possible for the date.  We can meet as close as one week before 4/7.   Before that I need to invoice as the payment has to be 10 days previous too the party date.Do you want to get together the third week in March?
Mary Ellen
On Mar 9, 2018, at 12:22 PM, Odalys Montpeirous <odalys.monty@gmail.com> wrote:
Mary Ellen,I would prefer to meet in the late afternoon around 3 pm or so.  Looking at package 2 or 3.  Do I have to wait for my photos, video and montage to be ready to have the finals appointment?
On Thu, Mar 8, 2018 at 9:52 AM, Bobby <bob@brilliancepro.com> wrote:
Odalys: Being that the Demo was a few months back I thought it  best to set up the “Finals” appt.  We would meet once more and go over all the details.  Color Selections for Walls/Columns Etc.  We would also go over the Montage, Logo, Photos etc.  Do you have an idea of which package you are going with?  Let me know what works for you and if you are available during the day or night only.
Mary Ellen 
On Mar 7, 2018, at 1:18 PM, odalys.monty <odalys.monty@gmail.com> wrote:
Yes.  What will i have to do at the finals appointment? And when is a good date?


Sent via the Samsung Galaxy S7 edge, an AT&T 4G LTE smartphone
-------- Original message --------From: Bobby <bob@brilliancepro.com> Date: 2/28/18  2:33 PM  (GMT-05:00) To: odalys.monty@gmail.com Subject: 4/7/2018 
odalys :  Going back to January 2018 we did a “Demo” at CATP.  As the date is quickly approaching
 I want to follow up as to whether you would like to set up a “Finals” appt the end of this month.

Mary Ellen  516-342-9955

Hey Bobby,

Hope you had a great weekend, I'm sure it was crazy as usual lol

Here's a list of what I need for the Spectrum Autism event on Thursday.
We're donating a lot of other stuff but I do have a minimal budget.

Event at Village Club of Sands Point
Setup is either Wed or Thurs, event is Thurs evening from

(2) Light Trees or Upright Truss with lighting for the band stage

Wireless LED Uplights (whatever you have)

I can get you a receipt for additional donation for tax purposes

Let me know its something you can help out with!

Subject: 3 highly recommended lighting fixtures
Body:
Dear Bob Richards,

Greeting from ERA Lighting.

We just returned to work from Chinese New Year vacation this month.

And we have 3 nice lights in mass production as below:
<http://link.gmapp4.net/x/c?c=2119230&l=0b321ccc-386f-4cc4-8e4e-5a824f125129&r=6aa68e04-bd19-4548-8623-df11514ae206>
*YY-M230*
230w YODN(OSRAM) lamp, silence working, rapid and extensive PAN and TILT
movement.
Video Link
<http://link.gmapp4.net/x/c?c=2119230&l=05cabc70-1624-4cc3-bae1-3775d197292f&r=6aa68e04-bd19-4548-8623-df11514ae206>
<http://link.gmapp4.net/x/c?c=2119230&l=75f762c1-0bf7-4372-9666-bceb936a25f3&r=6aa68e04-bd19-4548-8623-df11514ae206>
*YY-L1915Z*
19x15w RGBW 4 in 1 Osram Leds, Beam angle: 0-60 degree, beautiful beam and
wash function.
Video Link
<http://link.gmapp4.net/x/c?c=2119230&l=713f7add-6fe4-4ecc-8d28-98da28ab89f0&r=6aa68e04-bd19-4548-8623-df11514ae206>
<http://link.gmapp4.net/x/c?c=2119230&l=bf9f8084-4ba8-40e3-a482-ee6dd32c58c3&r=6aa68e04-bd19-4548-8623-df11514ae206>
*YY-P1818W*
18x18W RGBWA+UA 6in1 Leds, silence working, high brightness, uniform color
mixing.
Video Link
<http://link.gmapp4.net/x/c?c=2119230&l=c68da0b6-f564-4ae5-8d2b-37e28722d227&r=6aa68e04-bd19-4548-8623-df11514ae206>

Moderate price will be advised once you reply us. Thanks!

Best regards,
*Betty Bai, **ERA Lighting Limited*



*Mobile: +8613535201070 <+8613535201070> | Email: info@eralighting.com
<info@eralighting.com> | Web: https://www.eralighting.com

Subject: Potential Client for Super Sounds Entertainment
Body:
Super Sounds Entertainment

A potential client just viewed your company profile on WeDJ.com and likely visited your website! The visitor did not provide specific contact information.

Search Result Demographics

Prospect Search Page: Westbury DJs

IP Address: 54.36.148.129

Event Date: Not Provided

Contact Info: Not Provided

Time of Day: 03/17/2018 1:27:47 AM Central Time

Gigbuilder TIP:  (Login )

Never use paper worksheet forms again!

Build the worksheet of your dreams. In fact, build as many as you want. Each event in Gigbuilder can have virtually unlimited worksheets and your clients can fill them out online or by smartphone. Each worksheet can be up to about three pages long and have text fields, drop down boxes, yes and no boxes, time fields, star rating fields, paragraphs, selected text, and much more. Click Setup -> Event Planning -> Worksheets to begin the adventure.

For additional information view at the following knowledgebase article: Worksheet KB Article

Get some FREE publicity FAST and EASY

Visit WeDJ.com and navigate to pages where you want your business to show up and make comments in the Facebook widget then visit your profile page and do the same. Make sure to click to post on Facebook too and you'll get a free inbound link to your profile from Facebook!!

Get More Hits FREE

Put the WeDJ badge on your website and it will link directly to your profile page thus increasing SEO for both of us!

Log into your account and click the Resources tab or Click for code  or copy the following line to your browser:

www.wedj.com/dj-photo-video.nsf/badge.html?open&id=4B5561A0CA567092862571A300430B93

The badge must be placed anywhere on your http://brilliancepro.com website to appear and cannot be altered in any manner.

Regards,

WeDJ.com Support Team

Click UNSUBSCRIBE PROSPECT EMAILS to stop prospect notification emails. Learn More

You will still receive lead emails and other communication emails.

Subject: Fwd: Travel Advisory | Important Terminal 4 information | Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport (FLL)
Body:
Kathy Richards

Begin forwarded message:

From: "JetBlue Info" <info@change.jetblue.com<mailto:info@change.jetblue.com>>
Date: April 7, 2018 at 12:43:27 PM EDT
To: KIOVINO@LIVE.COM<mailto:KIOVINO@LIVE.COM>
Subject: Travel Advisory | Important Terminal 4 information | Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport (FLL)

[Your Upcoming Flight]


Dear Kathleen M Richards,

We want to share some information should your flight be scheduled for either arrival or departure through Terminal 4 at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport, FL (FLL):

  *   The only check-in option for all JetBlue flights departing FLL is located in Terminal 3.

  *   JetBlue gates in Terminal 4 are located at the end of the terminal.

  *   Terminals 3 and 4 are connected post TSA security checkpoint, and customers will still use the Terminal 3 TSA checkpoint if departing from Terminal 4.

  *   With current airport construction considered, the walk through Terminal 4 to our gates can take a bit more time.


  *   It is always recommended to double check the gate assignment for your flight upon arrival at the airport in case of a gate change between the time your boarding pass is printed and your arrival at FLL.

All this in mind, we encourage you to allow for extra travel time if needed to reach your gate in plenty of time for your departure.

As always, please check the status of your flight online<https://www.jetblue.com/flightstatus/#/> or via the JetBlue app<http://www.jetblue.com/mobile/> prior to arriving at the airport.

Thank you for choosing to fly with us. We look forward to welcoming you at FLL.

Sincerely,

JetBlue


Help<http://www.jetblue.com/help/?intcmp=hd_help.html?source=EMBLUEPERIOD_111>   TrueBlue<http://www.jetblue.com/trueblue/FF_Login.aspx?PleaseLogin=true&source=EMBLUEPERIOD_112&REFPAGE=FF_History.aspx>   Corporate Travel<http://www.jetblue.com/corporate/?intcmp=ft_corporate.html?source=EMBLUEPERIOD_113>   Privacy<http://www.jetblue.com/legal/privacy/?intcmp=ft_privacy.html?source=EMBLUEPERIOD_114>   About JetBlue<http://www.jetblue.com/about/?intcmp=ft_aboutus.html?source=EMBLUEPERIOD_115>  <http://www.facebook.com/JetBlue>        Facebook<http://www.facebook.com/JetBlue>      <http://www.twitter.com/jetbluecheeps>   Twitter<http://www.twitter.com/jetbluecheeps>

We're sorry but email sent in reply to this message will not be answered. If you have questions, please visit our website's Help<http://www.jetblue.com/help/> section for assistance. JetBlue, 6322 South 3000 East, Suite G10, Salt Lake City, UT 84121.


©2018 JetBlue

Subject: Re: Eden Spielman - 5-5-18

Screen 2 (behind the DJ Booth I could do that also .  I am concerned if we use all the pictures upon entrance it would be too fast.  As of today I have the above.  I know White Light is working on the Montage, have them send it to 

me (Dropbox) when available, as I like to test it before day of on our system.  When available send me the logo also.  I have made a notation ET is doing the Zap Shots.  I will be speaking to you or Jennifer over the next few

weeks to make sure we have everything 100%.

 

Mary Ellen

Body:

Thanks and sorry
Christian

From: Bobby <bob@brilliancepro.com>
Date: Monday, April 9, 2018 at 3:55 PM
To: "Keck, Christian" <ckeck@nybg.org>
Subject: Re: Theater Lighting

Thank you for your email.  Can we try for April 19 at 2 PM?


Christian

Date: Friday, April 6, 2018 at 10:50 AM
To: "Keck, Christian" <ckeck@nybg.org<mailto:ckeck@nybg.org>>
Subject: Re: Theater Lighting

Christian:  Bob will be out of the Country  until the week off April 16th.  If you would like I could set an appointment for either April 18th or the 19th. if that works for yourself and Edwin.  I can be reached
via e-mail or 516-342-9955.

Mary Ellen/Brilliance

On Apr 5, 2018, at 10:46 AM, Keck, Christian <ckeck@nybg.org<mailto:ckeck@nybg.org>> wrote:

Bob thank you for the follow-up.

Do you have some time next week for us to meet?  Thomas is out but you, Edwin, and I can meet to review the space and short term and long-term goals.

Let me know your availability for next week.


Thanks
Christian

Christian Keck

2900 Southern Boulevard

Subject: Ferraro et ano vs. Rodriguez, et ano. - E-FILE-0381691799.1
Body:
Bob@brilliancepro.com and s.rod82@yahoo.com

Dear Bob and Samantha,
As you know, we continue to represent your interests in this matter. As you know the depositions (EBT) were adjourned to 5/11/18. Samantha, I am aware that you are at college and I will adjourn your EBT and see if plaintiff's counsel wishes to proceed with the plaintiff only. Patti, of my office, will be in touch with you regarding the EBTs. Please let me know when you will return home for the summer.

The Claims Department is processing the authorizations for the plaintiff's medical records.

I shall continue to keep you apprised of all developments.

Best,
Rose Woodrick, Esq.

Ok thank you Mary Ellen.
I will have guys working in another building at the Botanical Garden on that day so either the foreman or myself will join Bob at the meeting.

The location of this work is the NY Botanical Garden in the Bronx.  I sent Bob pictures of the auditorium.  We recently completed an audio and video installation in the auditorium and now the customer is looking for a proposal for a new lighting system.

Subject: RE: Bar Mitzvah 4/21/18
Body:
Hi Bobby,

 

Just confirming this Saturday. Can you email me the signed contract by today
or tomorrow?

And what the power requirements for this?

 

Also, we are working with a planner (and client) that's super particular
about everything. I received this from the planner, Jessica, and I want to
make sure to pass this on to you so you can relay to the techs on Saturday:

 

"Since I have not worked with all of you before, I do kindly request that
all vendors wear all black business attire including sleeves to the elbow
and closed shoes (no sandals). This includes all delivery people. Men may
wear suit jacket and tie if they wish. I thank you in advance. 

 

If you should need a beverage during the event, please ask me or anyone on
my team, or the event manager to get it for you. One of my biggest pet
peeves is seeing a vendor eating and drinking from the guest food station
and bars. I am here to assist you. It does not look good to the guests if
they see a vendor in line for anything, and they don't know if you are
getting water or alcohol so that is why I will be happy to grab you a
water."

 

Who is the tech(s) on Saturday and what time are they arriving? Can you make
sure they have my cell 646-708-2439 and to only ask me if they have any
questions.

 

Thank you, Bobby.

 

Charissa

 

 

From: Bobby [mailto:bob@brilliancepro.com] 
Sent: Monday, March 19, 2018 10:31 AM
To: Admin (Expressway Music) <admin@expresswaymusic.com>
Subject: Bar Mitzvah 4/21/18

Subject: Drexel University Supplier Required Registration for The Drexel University Smart Source Supplier Portal
Body:
Supplier Invitation for The Drexel University Smart Source Supplier Portal Dear Brilliance Event Productions,

The Drexel University Smart Source Supplier Portal is inviting you to register because a requester wishes to place an order with you OR has asked us to issue payment to you.  Registration is required in order to do business with Drexel University.  

 

The Drexel University Smart Source Supplier Portal is free, easy and it only takes a few minutes to join. By selecting the "Register Now" button below, you will be routed to a secure website to complete the registration process.  Upon acceptance and approval of your registration, you will be notified and can access the portal to:

Maintain your own data (addresses, contacts, banking information)

Add Tax and Insurance documents

Track Purchase Orders (POs) we issue to you

Flip POs to invoices

Track invoicing and payments

Please, if you experience any issues, contact our hot line via email

smartsource@drexel.edu or phone 215-895-2876; do not contact our departments for assistance as they have no insight into this process.

 

Register Now Thank You,

The Drexel University Smart Source Supplier Portal

If you have any technical questions, please contact Debbie Rizzo Director, Business Support at

askprocure@drexel.edu or +215 (895) 2876 for assistance and identify yourself as registering in the The Drexel University Smart Source Supplier Portal Supplier Network.
Label: IMPORTANT,CATEGORY_PERSONAL,INBOX,UNREAD

Subject: Fwd: last outreach before we disconnect
Body:
Any idea who this is?

Kathy Richards

Begin forwarded message:

From: Claire Chen <claire.chen@newyorkislanders.com<mailto:claire.chen@newyorkislanders.com>>
Date: April 18, 2018 at 4:53:25 PM EDT
To: kiovino@live.com<mailto:kiovino@live.com>
Subject: last outreach before we disconnect

Robert,

Sorry we’ve been unable to connect up until this point. However definitely wanted to make sure you're taken care of.

Let me know if:

a. You’re busy, and I understand it may not be the best time for you to connect.
b. You’d like some more information to help determine what’s the best fit for you
c. You simply don’t ever want to come out to an Islanders/Nets game

No worries at all, as you’ll always have a friend at the Barclays Center no matter what. I’ve included my contact information below for your convenience. If you, or anyone you know, can ever benefit from my services at the Islanders/Nets please feel free to reach out anytime via email or phone.

We have an awesome referral program that rewards you when you bring more fans on board.
https://www.nhl.com/islanders/tickets/two-man-advantage<http://go.newyorkislanders.com/b9e1f7ee1ac93ef209>

Thanks, and I look forward to the possibility of working with you in the future!

Best,
Claire

Account Executive

New York Islanders
15 MetroTech Center, 11th Floor
Brooklyn, New York 11201

Subject: Long Island Marathon 2018 (more)
Body:
This is what I believe I requested from you last year:





Sunday May 6 - Charles Lindbergh Blvd

- 10K Race Truss:  (35'?)
- Marathon Truss: (40'?)
- Crank-up ground support for both, setup in the AM before 6AM.



Saturday May 5 - Eisenhower Park (can be setup Friday / Friday evening)
- 2 Upright trusses on weight bases (10' tall?  Taller?).  These will be used to hold vertical banners that say "Start"
(I may actually have the equipment -bases and light-weight truss- but I would need sand bags and labor


 I will need to rent 8 pop-up tents.  I am not sure if I need any generators or not, as the park supplies those and we may have enough - I will get back to you.


Labor - Sunday May 6
I am not sure, yet, but if you have a couple of guys available to work the day, as you did last year, I have some other video stuff that I may need help setting up.   This may include moving the trusses that are to be used for the 5K start over to the results tent or something and having monitors put on them (not sure if I need to rent monitors from you or not - I haven't confirmed the availability of all the technology yet.


I am not sure if I need anything else as of this time, but I will let you know asap.  I am finalizing a lot of things tomorrow.


Thank you,
Jason
Label: IMPORTANT,CATEGORY_PERSONAL,INBOX,UNREAD

Subject: Long Island Marathon
Body:
So, it seems that I sent this email to "brillianceproduction@hotmail.com" - not sure why, but I guess I had it in my address book and didn't pay much attention.


Sorry I didn't call you back, I got another call as soon as I walked in - it's been that kind of month.


Here is the email I sent the other day:




Hey Bobby, how are you?

A few things..


Any chance I am ever going to see anything from the LED video screen job from Feb 2017??


Second, the Long Island Marathon is May 4 - May 6 with the Marathon / Half / 10K on May 6.  We will again need trussing for the starting line.  I will also need at least one truss at the finish line and if possible, would like to have your guys setup some other equipment for me on Saturday and Sunday.


Please let me know what your availability is for that weekend.




Thanks!


Jason
Label: IMPORTANT,CATEGORY_PERSONAL,INBOX

Subject: NYU Winthrop Hospital 2018 Men's Health Seminar
Body:
Good Morning,


On Saturday, June 16th  NYU Winthrop Hospital  will present the  2018 Men's Health Seminar.

Dr. Katz is thrilled to announce this year's Keynote Speaker, Dr. Michael Roizen.  Dr. Roizen is Cleveland Clinic's Chief Wellness Officer and served as first Chair of the  Wellness Institute.  Dr. Roizen published a series of highly popular bestsellers including 4 #1 New York Times bestsellers: translated into 44 languages and ranked #1 in five countries.  Dr. Roizen has 9 overall NY Times Bestsellers and he has given over 1,400 talks to lay and medical groups.  He and Dr. Oz write a daily column syndicated to 134 newspapers; hosts a podcast on what the latest medical science means to you weekly.  He shared a daytime Emmy, an Elle, a lifetime achievement award, and the Paul Rodgers award for best medical communicator from the National Library of Medicine.
Dr. Roizen will present  at this year's Men's Health Seminar " How Wellness Makes Sense for You" including what choices you can make to keep your brain young.

Additional sessions  presented by prestigious NYU Winthrop Physicians will include topics addressing controversies in prostate cancer treatments,  causes and treatment of common urinary issues, management of rising PSA, digestive & colon health,  the importance of sleep for men's health, treatment options for erectile dysfunction & low testosterone, an overview of the harms of stress & the healing powers of mindfulness and optimal heart health, the prevention and management of hypertension and cardiovascular disease.

Please see the attached postcard for more information and instructions  on how to register for this event or you may visit www.menshealthseminar.com<http://www.menshealthseminar.com>.



Keynote Speaker:
Michael Roizen, MD

Why Wellness Makes Sense For You: 10 Choices to Keep your Brain Young

Dr. Roizen is Cleveland Clinic's Chief Wellness Officer and a NY Times best selling co-author with Dr. Oz.

* Controversies in Prostate Cancer Treatments

Aaron Katz, MD, FACS; Jonathan Haas, MD; Anthony Corcoran, MD, FACS

* Causes and treatment of common urinary issues

Jeffrey Schiff, MD, FACS

* Management of Rising PSA

James Lewis, PA-C

* Digestive & Colon Health

Jules Garbus, MD

* The Importance of Sleep for Men's Health

Qanta Ahmed, MD

* Treatment Options for Erectile Dysfunction & Low Testosterone

Brett Mellinger, MD

* Be the Mindful Man: An Overview of the Harms of Stress and Healing Powers of Mindfulness

Deepan Singh, MD & Carole Filangieri, PhD

* Optimal Heart Health: Prevention and Management of Hypertension and Cardiovascular Disease

Ramesh Daggubati, MD

Register online today! www.menshealthseminar.com





Kate Owens
Specialist, Education Programs
Department of Urology
NYU Winthrop Hospital
1300 Franklin Ave. Suite ML6
Garden City, NY 11530
Phone: 516-663-2316
Fax: 516-663-8784

[cid:image001.jpg@01D3C834.4A616DB0]

The Drexel University Smart Source Supplier Portal is a best in class Supplier Registration and eProcurement system. Accessible via the world-wide-web, The Drexel University Smart Source Supplier Portal provides a one-stop, complete solution for Buyer/Supplier communications.

Subject: RE: Bronx Botanical gardens
Body:
Bob,

Can you write a Scope Of Work for the lighting proposal?  Just a paragraph that spells out in layman's terms what we are proposing.  This will help me manage customer expectations for the project.  It should spell out what is included in the project, and what we are expecting (if anything) from the customer, such as electrical, scaffolding, building access hours, etc.   Would it be possible to get this to me by tomorrow afternoon at the latest?


I am going there on Friday morning and will count the chair mounted Isle lights and take pictures of them.  I guess we will make a second proposal for that after I bring back that information.


John Schappert | Director of Operations
Adwar Video
125 Gazza Blvd
Farmingdale, NY  11735

john@adwarvideo.com<mailto:john@adwarvideo.com>

Body:
Hi Mary Ellen,
Jack's bar mitzvah on April 20 was wonderful...but it dawned on me the morning after that the Loop Photos were never shown on the screens as we had discussed.  I even asked a number of guests and they said all they saw were the same 4 photos.  There is certainly nothing we can do about it now but I did want to make you aware of this!
ThanksMarni



 

    On Friday, April 20, 2018, 3:51:13 PM EDT, Bobby <bob@brilliancepro.com> wrote:  
 
 Hi Marni
The techs show up one hour prior to the cocktail hour

> On Apr 20, 2018, at 3:42 PM, Marni Altfest <maltfest07@yahoo.com> wrote:
> 
> 
> Hi Mary Ellen
> Can you tell me what time the tech arrives?
> Our photos start at 5:30 and I of course would like the ambiance of the lights!!
> Also, the screen behind the dj seems somewhat small for the montage- is that the only screen it can be viewed on?? It is set back and the dj and brilliance will be in front of it- or are they using the one that is set to the left side??
> Thanks!!
> 
> 
> Sent from Marni's iPhone

Thanks
Dave

Subject: RE: Bronx Botanical gardens
Body:
Thank you Bob this is very helpful.

Can we also include that at the conclusion of the installation that you will provide a 1 hour training session for the end users?


John Schappert | Director of Operations
Adwar Video
125 Gazza Blvd
Farmingdale, NY  11735
OFFICE:  631 777-7070 ext.122
MOBILE: 516 316-4967
john@adwarvideo.com<mailto:john@adwarvideo.com>
www.adwarvideo.com<http://www.adwarvideo.com/>

From: Brilliance [mailto:bob@brilliancepro.com]
Sent: Thursday, May 10, 2018 9:08 PM
To: John Schappert
Subject: Re: Bronx Botanical gardens

Hi John
listed below is an outline of the work proposed for the lighting install at the Bronx Botanical Gardens

1 - Set up 18ft of contractor scaffolding
2 - Remove all preexisting stage lighting fixtures
3 - Install New LED fixtures to truss with salty cable
4 - Install 5 pin data cable to all fixtures
5 - Install wireless DMX system to truss
6 - Set up wireless DMX system in booth
7 - Install light jockey lighting program
8 - Program lighting to clients request

NOTE: 1 - Licensed electrician to supply three 20amp circuits to truss system
            2 - Light jockey program is a computer program. This must be installed into a computer supplied by the center









 On May 9, 2018, at 12:45 PM, John Schappert <john@adwarvideo.com<mailto:john@adwarvideo.com>> wrote:

Bob,

Can you write a Scope Of Work for the lighting proposal?  Just a paragraph that spells out in layman’s terms what we are proposing.  This will help me manage customer expectations for the project.  It should spell out what is included in the project, and what we are expecting (if anything) from the customer, such as electrical, scaffolding, building access hours, etc.   Would it be possible to get this to me by tomorrow afternoon at the latest?


I am going there on Friday morning and will count the chair mounted Isle lights and take pictures of them.  I guess we will make a second proposal for that after I bring back that information.


John Schappert | Director of Operations
Adwar Video
125 Gazza Blvd
Farmingdale, NY  11735
OFFICE:  631 777-7070 ext.122
MOBILE: 516 316-4967
john@adwarvideo.com<mailto:john@adwarvideo.com>
www.adwarvideo.com<http://www.adwarvideo.com/>

From: Bobby [mailto:bob@brilliancepro.com]
Sent: Thursday, May 3, 2018 12:50 PM
To: John Schappert
Subject: Bronx Botanical gardens


<Bronx Botanical Gardens 2018.pdf>

Subject: RE: Brilliance
Body:
Bob,

I may not have enough of the Power Pars available.  We have two different versions of them and if we can supply all that you need, it will need to be a mixture of the two.  I'm checking on an existing reservation to see if this can be possible.  I have another option.  I've attached a cut sheet for the Elation Fuze 575.  This is a cool white moving head that we are planning to use as replacements for the Powerpars which we seem to be phasing out.  Please take a look and let me know if you think this might be an option for you.  I have plenty of the Fuze 575's available.  Please let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks,

Jim

Subject: Re: Delivery Status Notification (Delay)
Body:
Hi Bobby,

Thank you for sending this over. I forwarded your email over to Deslyn
earlier and she has it now.  I also let her know that you needed
approximately 4 hours to set-up and they are going to get back to me about
Friday night.  It looks like they are going to allow it, but we need to
wait on the building manager for final approval.

I will stay on top of it and let you know as soon as I hear anything. Reach
out anytime if you need anything from me or Steve.

Thank you,
Sean

Bobby,

Attached is your quote.  This quote does not include the Scissor Lift, Fork Lift or labor.  The quote included is for the split of two types of Power Pars, but I still don't have confirmation that we have these available.  I also noted on the quote the price to change the Power Pars to Elation Fuze 575's.  The noted price is the full price for the Fuze fixtures. Jim

Subject: RE: May 17th, 2018 EVENT PROGRAM DETAILS
Body:
Hi Bob,

We are excited to be working with your team again this year for our Builder's Breakfast this Thursday.  I wanted to start sending over the media pieces for our program.  I have attached a draft of the script that highlights the order of the audio visual tools.  We are making a few changes to the script, but not in terms of the order of the program.  Also below is a dropbox link with the video files that are needed.  We are not using the ReStore video that is included in the link.  I am putting some finishing touches on the scrolling powerpoint that will be playing while everyone is walking in and then again when everyone is walking out.

Here is a quick breakdown of the program:

7:30AM- guests start arriving/registering

*         Scrolling picture Powerpoint

*         Light music playing in the background
8:05AM- Program begins

*         Switch to a static slide of our 30th Anniversary logo (how would you like me to send this to you?  Just logo or a static slide in powerpoint?)

*         First video: 30th Anniversary Video, then back to static slide

*         Second video: CEO Build, then back to static slide

*         Third Video: 16 Years later, then back to static slide

*         ReStore Logo

*         Static Slide
9:00AM- Program ends, as people are leaving put the Scrolling picture powerpoint back up.

Video Links (we will not be using the ReStore one, so only 3 or the 4):
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/enck3bg8m7qgxq5/AAABEvEoXkRiZM_siTNcCh44a?dl=0

Les mentioned that there is an event at Stonebridge that afternoon before, so your guys will be coming in to set up late Wednesday night.  I would like to do a run through with them the morning of the program.  What time will the guys be able to be there Thursday morning?

Respectfully,

[Steph Email Signature]<http://www.habitatsuffolk.org/>

[fbk]<http://www.facebook.com/habitat.suffolk>[twitter]<https://twitter.com/habitatsuffolk>[instagram]<instagram.com/habitatsuffolk>[linkedin]<linkedin.com/in/habitatsuffolk>

From: Les Scheinfeld
Sent: Monday, May 14, 2018 10:26 AM
To: Stephanie Busia <Steph@habitatsuffolk.org>
Subject: FW: May 17th, 2018



From: Bobby [mailto:bob@brilliancepro.com]
Sent: Tuesday, May 01, 2018 1:26 PM
To: Les Scheinfeld <les@habitatsuffolk.org<mailto:les@habitatsuffolk.org>>
Subject: May 17th, 2018

Subject: [FWD: FW: SHRM-LI 5-23-18 Breakfast Meeting Presentation]
Body:
Good Morning, Bobby,

Our next SHRM-Li chapter meeting is this Wednesday, May 23rd @ 8:00 a.m. till 10:00 a.m.

I've requested that the venue, Carlyle at the Palace in Plainview, be open at 7:00 a.m. for all to set up.

We will need the usual five screens, a lavaliere mic and a hand held mic.  In addition our guest speaker has asked for "an HDMI cord or something to hook up her laptop to the AVs projector system".   If this is not something you typically supply, please let me know and I will ask the speaker to bring her own.

Please confirm you can provide the above and send me an invoice so we can have a check for you Wednesday morning.

Any questions, please do not hesitate to call me on my cell #631.374.6440.

As always, thank you for your professional service.

Warm regards,

Joan

Joan M. Convery, SHRM-CP; PHR 

Executive Board Member - Secretary

Chapter #213

Body:
Bob,

I counted 42 lights for the isles.
See attached pictures.


John Schappert | Director of Operations
Adwar Video
125 Gazza Blvd
Farmingdale, NY  11735
OFFICE:  631 777-7070 ext.122
MOBILE: 516 316-4967
john@adwarvideo.com<mailto:john@adwarvideo.com>
www.adwarvideo.com<http://www.adwarvideo.com/>

From: Brilliance [mailto:bob@brilliancepro.com]
Sent: Friday, May 11, 2018 8:17 AM
To: John Schappert
Subject: Re: Bronx Botanical gardens

Hi John
listed below is an outline of the work proposed for the lighting install at the Bronx Botanical Gardens

1 - Set up 18ft of contractor scaffolding
2 - Remove all preexisting stage lighting fixtures
3 - Install New LED fixtures to truss with salty cable
4 - Install 5 pin data cable to all fixtures
5 - Install wireless DMX system to truss
6 - Set up wireless DMX system in booth
7 - Install light jockey lighting program
8 - Program lighting to clients request
9 - Instruction to staff on the use of
       Light Jockey
NOTE: 1 - Licensed electrician to supply three 20amp circuits to truss system
            2 - Light jockey program is a computer program. This must be installed into a computer supplied by the center









 On May 9, 2018, at 12:45 PM, John Schappert <john@adwarvideo.com<mailto:john@adwarvideo.com>> wrote:

Bob,

Can you write a Scope Of Work for the lighting proposal?  Just a paragraph that spells out in layman’s terms what we are proposing.  This will help me manage customer expectations for the project.  It should spell out what is included in the project, and what we are expecting (if anything) from the customer, such as electrical, scaffolding, building access hours, etc.   Would it be possible to get this to me by tomorrow afternoon at the latest?


I am going there on Friday morning and will count the chair mounted Isle lights and take pictures of them.  I guess we will make a second proposal for that after I bring back that information.


John Schappert | Director of Operations
Adwar Video
125 Gazza Blvd
Farmingdale, NY  11735
OFFICE:  631 777-7070 ext.122
MOBILE: 516 316-4967
john@adwarvideo.com<mailto:john@adwarvideo.com>
www.adwarvideo.com<http://www.adwarvideo.com/>

Subject: Re: Johnson/Browne Wedding 8/24/18
Body:
Good Morning,

I wanted to thank you for setting up the lighting demonstration yesterday. Besides the fact that everything was amazing, I want to give a small review for the technician Steven that came to meet us. He was very helpful in explain the packages, carefully showed us various options with thought involved and accommodated me who had to FaceTime in through my fiancé because my train was extremely late and I could not make it on time. So much so that I missed the initial presentation but he kindly stayed and then presented again. To me, that showed empathy, amazing work ethic and dedication that he did not need to provide but did so. He is a wonderful individual and please pass this note on to him if you can. We (especially I) am so thankful! Besides the excellent presentation, he helped to make our decision an easy one. 

We are very interested in investing in a package with Brilliance. Please let me know what the next steps are to get the process started!

Thank you so much for taking the time out to read this email and I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Respectfully yours,
Tasia Johnson

On the run! This email was sent from my iPhone so please excuse any typos or misspellings! Thank you! ☺️

On Apr 30, 2018, at 4:15 PM, Bobby <bob@brilliancepro.com> wrote:

> Tasia:  I will be in touch tmw.  Mary Ellen
>> On Apr 30, 2018, at 10:01 AM, Bobby <Bob@brilliancepro.com> wrote:
>> 
>> Tasia:  I am going to forward over a price sheet for the uplighting at The Heritage Club.  If you would like we could set up a demo for one of our techs 
>> to meet you there .  The appt has to be in the evening as it has to dark for you to appreciate the Lighting as the room is all glass.  PLs let me 
>> know what evenings you are available?  
>> 
>> Thank you,  Mary Ellen 
>>> On Apr 29, 2018, at 8:43 PM, Tasia Johnson <johnsontasia86@gmail.com> wrote:
>>> 
>>> Good Night,
>>> 
>>> My name is Tasia Johnson and I am contacting you today in regards to my wedding on Friday, August 24th, 2018 at The Heritage Club at Bethpage. I wanted to inquire about a potential custom monogram and the need for uplighting for the wedding if needed. Under the suggestion of Cynthia from the venue, we wanted to come see a potential lighting presentation. If possible, could you please contact me here at johnsontasia86@gmail.com or at 646-269-6373. Thank you so much for your cooperation and consideration in advance!
>>> 
>>> Respectfully yours,
>>> Tasia Johnson 
>>> 
>> 
>

>> Good Morning,

>> I wanted to thank you for setting up the lighting demonstration yesterday. Besides the fact that everything was amazing, I want to give a small review for the technician Steven that came to meet us. He was very helpful in explain the packages, carefully showed us various options with thought involved and accommodated me who had to FaceTime in through my fiancé because my train was extremely late and I could not make it on time. So much so that I missed the initial presentation but he kindly stayed and then presented again. To me, that showed empathy, amazing work ethic and dedication that he did not need to provide but did so. He is a wonderful individual and please pass this note on to him if you can. We (especially I) am so thankful! Besides the excellent presentation, he helped to make our decision an easy one. 
>>

Subject: LED Wall Truss Rental
Body:
Hi Bob, I have attached a drawing of the truss layout and a list of proposed truss sections.


Video Wall Structure

1-

(3) 1-ton manual chain hoists

2-

Spansets and shackles to attach chain falls to truss and bumper bar

3-

One 20.5" truss goal post



-Horizontal (1) 10' + (1) 8'



-Legs (2) 8'+ (2) 5'


-Truss base (outriggers) consisting of (4) 2.5' truss pieces running upstage/downstage on both legs



-(4) 3-way corner blocks (2) per side, (one top and bottom of each leg)

4-

Ballast:  (30) sand bags

5-

Truss bolts and tools.










We are scheduled
Installation 10:00 AM on Friday June 22
Removal 10:00 PM on Wednesday June 27

Thanks, Ken



Ken Bush
KCB Events Inc.
kcbvents@outlook.com
516-652-2774

Subject: Re: Johnson/Browne Wedding 8/24/18
Body:
Good Afternoon,

We would like to take the full package with Wall kinetics, operator,
intelligent lights and custom monogram for the dance floor. Is there a
preferred method of payment? Please let me know what other information you
may need to eat the invoice/contract ready. Thank you!

Respectfully yours,
Tasia


On Thu, May 31, 2018 at 9:32 AM, Bobby <bob@brilliancepro.com> wrote:

> Tasia:  Thank you for the kind words I will pass this on to him.  As far
> as picking a package you let me know which works best for you , I will then
> send you an invoice/contract, and block the date.
> Payment is required 2 weeks previous to the date.   Hope this helps and
> look forward to working with you.  Mary Ellen
>
> On May 31, 2018, at 6:48 AM, Tasia Johnson <johnsontasia86@gmail.com>
> wrote:
>
> Good Morning,
>
> I wanted to thank you for setting up the lighting demonstration yesterday.
> Besides the fact that everything was amazing, I want to give a small review
> for the technician Steven that came to meet us. He was very helpful in
> explain the packages, carefully showed us various options with thought
> involved and accommodated me who had to FaceTime in through my fiancé
> because my train was extremely late and I could not make it on time. So
> much so that I missed the initial presentation but he kindly stayed and
> then presented again. To me, that showed empathy, amazing work ethic and
> dedication that he did not need to provide but did so. He is a wonderful
> individual and please pass this note on to him if you can. We (especially
> I) am so thankful! Besides the excellent presentation, he helped to make
> our decision an easy one.
>
> We are very interested in investing in a package with Brilliance. Please
> let me know what the next steps are to get the process started!
>
> Thank you so much for taking the time out to read this email and I look
> forward to hearing from you soon!
>
> Respectfully yours,
> Tasia Johnson
>
> On the run! This email was sent from my iPhone so please excuse any typos
> or misspellings! Thank you! ☺️
>
> On Apr 30, 2018, at 4:15 PM, Bobby <bob@brilliancepro.com> wrote:
>
> Tasia:  I will be in touch tmw.  Mary Ellen
>
> On Apr 30, 2018, at 10:01 AM, Bobby <Bob@brilliancepro.com> wrote:
>
> Tasia:  I am going to forward over a price sheet for the uplighting at The
> Heritage Club.  If you would like we could set up a demo for one of our
> techs
> to meet you there .  The appt has to be in the evening as it has to dark
> for you to appreciate the Lighting as the room is all glass.  PLs let me
> know what evenings you are available?
>
> Thank you,  Mary Ellen
>
> On Apr 29, 2018, at 8:43 PM, Tasia Johnson <johnsontasia86@gmail.com>
> wrote:
>
> Good Night,
>
> My name is Tasia Johnson and I am contacting you today in regards to my
> wedding on Friday, August 24th, 2018 at The Heritage Club at Bethpage. I
> wanted to inquire about a potential custom monogram and the need for
> uplighting for the wedding if needed. Under the suggestion of Cynthia from
> the venue, we wanted to come see a potential lighting presentation. If
> possible, could you please contact me here at johnsontasia86@gmail.com or
> at 646-269-6373. Thank you so much for your cooperation and consideration
> in advance!
>
> Respectfully yours,
> Tasia Johnson

Subject: Hyperion's Vacation Schedule June 2018
Body:
HYPERION LIGHTING'S VACATION SCHEDULE
                                                         JUNE 15, 2018 thru JUNE 26, 2018


                                                        HYPERION WILL CLOSE FOR VACATION ON FRIDAY, JUNE 15TH AT 11am
                                                                 AND WILL NOT REOPEN UNTIL TUESDAY, JUNE 26TH AT 8am.

                                                                              NO GOBOS WILL SHIP DURING THIS TIME.

                                                               PLEASE PLACE YOUR ORDERS EARLY TO ENSURE SHIPMENT
                                                                                 BEFORE WE CLOSE FOR VACATION.

                                                                                          HAVE A GREAT SUMMER!


                                                                                                                                                                         Thank You,
                                                                                                 Ken and Deb
                                                                                                                                                                Hyperion Lighting Inc.
                                                                                                                                                                826 North Queen Street

Subject: OUT OF WARRANTY REQUEST FORM
Body:
Dear Valued Optoma/TSC Customer,

In response to your inquiry, all units that come to service must have a RMA number. Packages without RMA number may or will be rejected. If you wish to send your unit for service, please complete the attached form entirely and fax it to (510) 897-8605. For your security, please do not email the completed form.

If a fax is not available, please contact Customer Service at (888) 942-2929 and we can take the information over the phone. Once your information is received, we will forward you a RMA number with shipping instructions via email within 24 hours.

Diagnosis:
Unit evaluation takes between 2-3 business days. A repair estimate will be forwarded to you via email.
Repair Time:
Our turnaround time for repair is between 7-10 business days from the day we receive your authorization. You will be advised if there is a delay on the repair in case of part(s) shortage.

Fees:
If you will approve the estimate, the labor charge is $100 per unit, $25 return shipping, plus cost of part(s). Your credit card on file will be charge when the unit is ready to ship.
If you will decline the estimate, we charge $85 for diagnostic fee and $25 return shipping. Your credit card on file will be charge when the unit is ready to ship. Please note that you are liable for the fees associated with diagnosing the problems with your unit so we can advise you of the estimate to repair.
Shipping Method:
Units are shipped via FedEx Ground service. Overnight and 2-day shipping are also available for an additional fee. Please contact customer service for details.
Payment Information:
Your credit card on file will not be charge until the end of process. However, we do require a prepayment fee of $110 for diagnostic fee and shipping.

If the prepayment of $110 is made by check, please fax a copy of the check along with the completed RMA form. Please make the check payable to Technical Service Corporation (subsidiary of Optoma Technology, Inc). Enclose the live check with the package upon sending the unit for service.
Please note that we do not accept Purchase Order number unless your Company or School has an account with us. If the Company or School has an account with TSC or Optoma, please fax a copy of the PO with the amount of $110.00 along with the completed RMA request form to (510) 897-8605. The PO should be payable to Technical Service Corporation (Subsidiary of Optoma Technology, Inc).
If you have any questions, please give us a call at (888) 942-2929 M-F 7am-5pm PST.

[cid:image001.jpg@01CE4084.7C3AEBA0]
Crystal Recinos Customer Service Representative
P 510.897.8642  F 510.897.8602
crystal.recinos@techservicecorp.com<mailto:crystal.recinos@techservicecorp.com>  |  www.optomausa.com<http://www.optomausa.com/>
3178 Laurelview Ct., Fremont, CA  94538

Legal Disclaimer: The information contained in this message including its attachment(s) may be privileged, confidential and exempt from disclosure under applicable law. It is intended to be read only by the individual or entity to whom it is addressed or by their designee. If the reader of this message is not the intended recipient, you are on notice that any distribution of this message, in any form, is strictly prohibited. If you have received this message in error, please immediately notify the sender and delete or destroy any copy of this message. This email and any attached files do not form part of a legally binding contract between recipient and Optoma Technology, Inc.






________________________________
This e-mail transmission and its attachment are intended only for the use of the individual or entity to which it is addressed, and may contain information that is privileged, confidential and exempted from disclosure under applicable law. If the reader is not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any disclosure, dissemination, distribution or copying of this communication, in part or entirety, is strictly prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient for this confidential e-mail, delete it immediately without keeping or distributing any copy and notify the sender immediately. The hard copies should also be destroyed. Thank you for your cooperation. Get some FREE publicity FAST and EASY

Visit WeDJ.com and navigate to pages where you want your business to show up and make comments in the Facebook widget then visit your profile page and do the same. Make sure to click to post on Facebook too and you'll get a free inbound link to your profile from Facebook!!

Subject: Super Sounds Entertainment, PHUB609234
Body:
Hello,

Thank you for purchasing insurance through the N.A.M.E. insurance program!  We are pleased to bind coverage on your insurance effective 6/5/2018 .

Attached is the evidence of your coverage.  The attached Certificate of Insurance can be presented to your customers as evidence of your insurance coverage.  As discussed, should you need a specific customer or venue listed as an additional insured on your certificate you can request that through our dedicated email address: name@bbofpa.com<mailto:name@bbofpa.com>.

You should have also received a payment receipt from our vendor, Authorize.net.

*Please note that if you've signed up for equipment coverage, we will need your equipment list as soon as possible. Your equipment will not be covered until we receive your list.*

We appreciate your business and look forward to working with you.

Have a nice day!


[image002]Kyle Palinkas, Assistant Account Manager
Brown & Brown of Pennsylvania, LP.
125 E. Elm Street, Suite 210, Conshohocken, PA 19428


PLEASE REMEMBER COVERAGE CANNOT BE BOUND, CHANGED OR CANCELLED BY LEAVING AN ELECTRONIC MESSAGE OR VOICE MAIL MESSAGE. The information contained in this communication, including attachments is privileged and confidential. It is intended only for the exclusive use of the addressee. If the reader of this message is not the intended recipient, or the employee or agent responsible for delivering it to the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution or copying of this communication is strictly prohibited. If you have received this communication in error, please notify us by telephone immediately. Thank you.

Subject: Greenberg Party June 16 - Carlyle
Body:
Hi Bob.

Thank you for taking the time to speak with me last week. I am sure you are
aware of the discussions that went on yesterday between Steve, Maryellen
and me. To say that this was difficult and unprofessional is an
understatement. I really did give this a lot of thought before I contacted
you today. I called 2x but there was no answer and the last time I called I
left messages (2x) and no one returned my calls.

I would like to speak with you when you have a moment. I would like this to
go smoothly and in the end be able to share on social media what a
wonderful experience I had using Brilliance at Carlyle.

Please contact me at 516-317-2843.

Best,
Hayley

-- 
Hayley Greenberg
Certified Personal Trainer
C.O.P.E. Certified Health Coach
*Villanova Nursing School C.O.P.E. *(Center for Obesity Prevention and
Education)
HayleyGtraining.tsfl.com
516-317-2843

Subject: FW: NYU Winthrop Hospital 2018 Men's Health Seminar
Body:
Don't miss the 2018 Men's Health Seminar!



NYU Winthrop Hospital  2018 Men's Health Seminar
Saturday, June 16th

Dr. Katz is thrilled to announce this year's Keynote Speaker, Dr. Michael Roizen.  Dr. Roizen is Cleveland Clinic's Chief Wellness Officer and served as first Chair of the  Wellness Institute.  Dr. Roizen published a series of highly popular bestsellers including 4 #1 New York Times bestsellers: translated into 44 languages and ranked #1 in five countries.  Dr. Roizen has 9 overall NY Times Bestsellers and he has given over 1,400 talks to lay and medical groups.  He and Dr. Oz write a daily column syndicated to 134 newspapers; hosts a podcast on what the latest medical science means to you weekly.  He shared a daytime Emmy, an Elle, a lifetime achievement award, and the Paul Rodgers award for best medical communicator from the National Library of Medicine.
Dr. Roizen will present  at this year's Men's Health Seminar " How Wellness Makes Sense for You" including what choices you can make to keep your brain young.

Additional sessions  presented by prestigious NYU Winthrop Physicians will include topics addressing controversies in prostate cancer treatments,  causes and treatment of common urinary issues, management of rising PSA, digestive & colon health,  the importance of sleep for men's health, treatment options for erectile dysfunction & low testosterone, an overview of the harms of stress & the healing powers of mindfulness and optimal heart health, the prevention and management of hypertension and cardiovascular disease.

Please see the attached postcard for more information and instructions  on how to register for this event or you may visit
www.menshealthseminar.com<http://www.menshealthseminar.com>.



Keynote Speaker:
Michael Roizen, MD

Why Wellness Makes Sense For You: 10 Choices to Keep your Brain Young

Dr. Roizen is Cleveland Clinic's Chief Wellness Officer and a NY Times best selling co-author with Dr. Oz.

* Controversies in Prostate Cancer Treatments

Aaron Katz, MD, FACS; Jonathan Haas, MD; Anthony Corcoran, MD, FACS

* Causes and treatment of common urinary issues

Jeffrey Schiff, MD, FACS

* Management of Rising PSA

James Lewis, PA-C

* Digestive & Colon Health

Jules Garbus, MD

* The Importance of Sleep for Men's Health

Qanta Ahmed, MD

* Treatment Options for Erectile Dysfunction & Low Testosterone

Brett Mellinger, MD

* Be the Mindful Man: An Overview of the Harms of Stress and Healing Powers of Mindfulness

Deepan Singh, MD & Carole Filangieri, PhD

* Optimal Heart Health: Prevention and Management of Hypertension and Cardiovascular Disease

Ramesh Daggubati, MD

Register online today! www.menshealthseminar.com<http://www.menshealthseminar.com>





Kate Owens
Specialist, Education Programs
Department of Urology
NYU Winthrop Hospital
1300 Franklin Ave. Suite ML6
Garden City, NY 11530
Phone: 516-663-2316
Fax: 516-663-8784

[cid:image001.jpg@01D3C834.4A616DB0]

Hello!  We will be having our annual luncheon at the Heritage Club in Bethpage on 10/25 from 11-2pm.  Since you are on the Heritage Club’s vendor list, I wanted to reach out to see if you had availability for that date as well as to get a quote.

This is what we required last year (and should be the same for this year):

1 WIRELESS UHF HANDHELD MIC. ON PODIUM BRING LARGE CLIP
1 DESK STAND WITHOUT MIC.
2 WIRELESS UHF HANDHELD MIC.
FOR Q & A'S

1 -4 INPUT STEREO AUDIO MIXER
1 GraphicEQ Mono 1/3 8va
1 STEREO AUDIO POWER AMP
4 EV Sx300 SPEAKER+STAND
1 LITTLITE GOOSENECK LIGHT PLACE ON PODIUM

Room needs to be set and ready by 10am.

Thank you!  I look forward to hearing from you.

Regards,
Tracey

Super Sounds Entertainment

Gigbuilder TIP:  (Login )

Setup your Client Login Portal

Gigbuilder has a robust and feature-rich client login portal where your clients can complete forms, provide additional event information, request music (for djs), make payments, and review communications.

Get some FREE publicity FAST and EASY

Visit WeDJ.com and navigate to pages where you want your business to show up and make comments in the Facebook widget then visit your profile page and do the same. Make sure to click to post on Facebook too and you'll get a free inbound link to your profile from Facebook!!

Get More Hits FREE

Put the WeDJ badge on your website and it will link directly to your profile page thus increasing SEO for both of us!

Log into your account and click the Resources tab or Click for code  or copy the following line to your browser:

www.wedj.com/dj-photo-video.nsf/badge.html?open&id=4B5561A0CA567092862571A300430B93

The badge must be placed anywhere on your http://brilliancepro.com website to appear and cannot be altered in any manner.

Subject: Lighting for MUTS 2018
Body:
Hey Bobby!

Music Under the Stars is almost here...yikes!  I'm sending all of the stage plots I have (some of them you  have already received).  Most of the bands are tributes or even repeats from last year, and everyone was more than pleased with the lighting last year!  Whenever you have some free time  let me know and we can talk lighting for the shows.

Thanks,
Krista Fileccia
Town of Oyster Bay
Cultural & Performing Arts Division
977 Hicksville Road
Massapequa, NY 11758
Phone (516) 797-7925
Fax (516) 797-7919

Subject: Event in DC
Body:
Hi Bob,

Just wanted to give you some of the details for the upcoming event……

Gaylord National Harbor 201 Waterfront Street, National Harbor, Maryland 20745 USA <https://www.marriott.com/hotels/maps/travel/wasgn-gaylord-national-resort-and-convention-center/>

https://www.google.com/maps/place/Gaylord+National+Resort+%26+Convention+Center,+Oxon+Hill,+MD+20745/@38.7814462,-77.0189621,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x89b7b0734d793d5d:0x7fccb753cbe0c4f7!8m2!3d38.7814462!4d-77.0167734 <https://www.google.com/maps/place/Gaylord+National+Resort+&+Convention+Center,+Oxon+Hill,+MD+20745/@38.7814462,-77.0189621,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x89b7b0734d793d5d:0x7fccb753cbe0c4f7!8m2!3d38.7814462!4d-77.0167734>

We are loading in on July 1st at 12pm

Setup commences in the Potomac Ballroom at 1pm

We will supply a hotel room for your (2) man crew.

Strike will be on July 5th at 6am PROMPT (we have to be clear from the ballroom at 10:30am)

Please supply the names and cell phones for your crew.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks,




Robert Lind



Fueled by knowledge and experience
516 823 9494 Off
516 823 9493 fax
rlind@avgroupny.com <mailto:rlind@avgroupny.com>

We need your help in order to better assist with your pet’s policy.

Subject: Audio for Fight for Charity Event - Tuesday, June 26 at Heritage Club
Body:
Bob,

We need extra audio equipment for a Fight for Charity event on Tuesday, June 26.

Here are the details:
Date:     Tuesday, June 26
Time:     Event runs from 6 - 8:30 p.m., so needs to be set up well in advance.
Place:    Heritage Club at Bethpage

Please email me if you need to discuss or have any questions, we are expecting a couple hundred people and need everything to work.

Regards,

Geoff Walter
Corbett PR

We were looking to set up a date at the Heritage Club to choose our
Kinetics color lighting. At this time, we are interested in the first
package. Do you have availability in the evening on Monday, July 9 or
Wednesday, July 11? Also, do you contact the Heritage Club to make sure
that they are available as well?

Thank you,
Ashleigh Salerno

Subject: FW: Luxul Class: Next Level Networking for the Custom Integrator
Body:
Good Afternoon,

I want to make sure you are aware of the LUXUL Next Level Networking for the Custom Integrator class is this Wednesday here in Plainview. This class is an extensive networking course with topics including: industry specific best practices for wired and wireless to overcome common network challenges, the importance of site surveys, the advantages of PDUs and remote monitoring, providing a higher level of security and parental control, making Wifi work for you, an explanation of mesh vs. active roaming and much more. This training is designed to help our dealers/integrators expand their IP networking knowledge, master the company's products and learn all about the exciting and profitable LUXUL/Domotz relationship.

Integrators utilizing Luxul routers with Domotz technology will receive alerts when network issues arise - allowing them to take immediate action - and can share device information with Luxul's support team for swift and easy troubleshooting. The routers also eliminate the need to purchase a separate Luxul Domotz Pro for remote management. This lowers network costs and speeds setup, improving the bottom line for integrators while providing a better experience for their clients.

LUXUL + Domotz = Recurring Revenue want to know more,
sign up here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/luxul-training-featuring-domotz-tickets-46952221358<http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0014Yn-e4HXimtJ3SexJwtIl2fwSG83c8mIHxYSotyirzc_mVUN3aSgWYHdTlGz1gACY5PRwpWZvVNG3SlYi18OcVgWs7DBEbJ-PRYW_IfRPAjXw-OBjcGjfYVCaSihabGd80limcE9QxCFgrcymaSHUJDz2mVmnL_WAgZsO-p82VwzZ0QjNqWQ2aH3xRi-A7uZaTlEo7mnj8XgLl0MZlPoFd-uSAOWmUbxB5n9JuZ4qOSZAF1CLY8ApTPFRff_Pao3&c=h7faqIbrTz40c3yqeBH0SP8jfrceJdiuZjYp8MDBM0xtgqNbNE7M_w==&ch=XOlPfehnihqeMuSgykXN9LdIzrhWNbw_vyzNfLH9FJA8fGYf_RSkow==>

If you or someone in your company is in charge of your clients networks, you should attend this class on Wednesday. There are two sessions, 9am-12pm and 1pm-4pm. Lunch will be served at Noon.

I hope to see you here.

Best regards,
Dave

Dave Silkin | President
DSG Distributors
www.dsgdist.com<http://www.dsgdist.com/>
Plainview N.Y. | Southampton N.Y.
516.249.8800 main
516.249.8900 fax
631.445.9692 mobile
Ask us about LG Commercial Displays
[facebook]<https://www.facebook.com/DsgDist>[twitter]<https://twitter.com/> [Linkedin] <http://www.linkedin.com/nhome/>

Body:
Sorry for this last minute change, but the location of the Thursday, July 12, 2018 concert - Dr. K's Motown Revue will be as follows:

Old Location:                      Bethpage Community Park
                                                1001 Stewart Ave
Bethpage, NY 11714


New Location:                   JFK Middle School

Bethpage, NY 11714

We have used this location in the past (back in 2008).  If you have any questions or concerns please let me know.  Paul we will update the website and our flyers with the new location.

Krista Fileccia

lighting options for our wedding.  Our first demo was during the day and
we'd like to have a second demo at night so that we can get the full
effect. Please let me know some dates and times that could work.

Thank you!
Megan Butler

Respectfully yours,
Tasia

>>>>>>> On May 31, 2018, at 6:48 AM, Tasia Johnson <johnsontasia86@gmail.com> wrote:
>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>> Good Morning,
>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>> I wanted to thank you for setting up the lighting demonstration yesterday. Besides the fact that everything was amazing, I want to give a small review for the technician Steven that came to meet us. He was very helpful in explain the packages, carefully showed us various options with thought involved and accommodated me who had to FaceTime in through my fiancé because my train was extremely late and I could not make it on time. So much so that I missed the initial presentation but he kindly stayed and then presented again. To me, that showed empathy, amazing work ethic and dedication that he did not need to provide but did so. He is a wonderful individual and please pass this note on to him if you can. We (especially I) am so thankful! Besides the excellent presentation, he helped to make our decision an easy one. 
>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>> We are very interested in investing in a package with Brilliance. Please let me know what the next steps are to get the process started!
>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>> Thank you so much for taking the time out to read this email and I look forward to hearing from you soon!
>>>>>>>
