Subject: 2018 HOG 1797 Summer Newsletter
Body:
Hello Members,

Attached you'll find the Summer 2018 newsletter.

Sunday, July 8th at 9:00 am is our next Chapter Meeting.
Levittown VFW 55 Hickory Lane, Levittown, New York 11756.
Bagels, Rolls, Coffee, Tea and O.J.
$5.00 PP collected at the door, includes you in a raffle for
Dealer Gift Certificates donated by our sponsoring dealer, H-D of Nassau County.
The after meeting ride will be our biker blessing, we will ride out to Holbrook, to the Rushing Wind Biker Church, where Paster Gerry Waldron will be doing the blessing.

We want your chapter pix for our newsletter. We welcome and encourage personal riding photos (short stories too) from events or vacations outside of our chapter. Sharing an adventure inspires others! Please send your pictures/stories/ideas to our editor, Anne Leone (macktsbabe@gmail.com <mailto:macktsbabe@gmail.com>)

Thanks, and ride safe!

John Vezzi


Secretary
Label: IMPORTANT,CATEGORY_PERSONAL,INBOX,UNREAD

Subject: Thank you from the Service Department at East Hills Chevrolet of Freeport
Body:
Robert,
Hi, this is Mark Smith and I am the Service Manager at East Hills Chevrolet of Freeport. I just wanted to take time to say thank you for your recent visit to our Service Department. I hope that my service team was able to help you with all of your needs.
You may be selected to receive a customer satisfaction (CSI) survey in the near future. Our #1 goal is for all of our customers to be 100% Completely Satisfied. If you are less than completely satisfied then I would encourage you to contact me at your earliest convenience so that I can work towards making things right.
Thank you for your continued support and we look forward to seeing you in the future.
Mark SmithService ManagerEast Hills Chevrolet of Freeport42 E. Sunrise HighwayFreeport, NY 11362Service Center: 516-623-9600Email: msmith@ehchevy.com
You are receiving this email because you inquired about or purchased a
vehicle from East Hills Chevrolet of Freeport recently or in the past.
If you prefer not to receive further emails from us,
click here
to unsubscribe. Alternatively, you can send a written request to the address below. We'll remove you from our list as quickly as possible.
This email was sent to bob@brilliancepro.com on July 07, 2018.
To contact us please visit http://www.EastHillsChevroletofFreeport.com or call (888) 296-7076.
This email was delivered to you by:
East Hills Chevrolet of Freeport
42 East Sunrise HighwayFreeport, NY 11520

Subject: load-out Grumman Studios
Body:
Hi erveyone,

Thanks for the great work on the load-in.

Wanted to touch base about the load-out schedule:

Sunday July 15
10:00pm car move out. - There is a soco cable that will need to be
disconnected for cars to move out. I will work with the client to make this
happen

Monday July 17
6:00am ­ Decorators start strike

10:00 am ­ Danny Hazen on site
10:00 am ­ Floor power removal ­ 2 crew needed. Brilliance Crew
12:00 pm ­ Main rig strike ­ 10 Person Crew Brilliance (should be down and
out in about 6 hours)
2:00 pm ­ Rigging Crew call
5:00 pm ­ Truck Load




Daniel Keranen
Werner Theatrical Supply, Inc
8560 Vineyard Ave
Suite 205
Rancho Cucamonga, Ca 91730
daniel@wtsevents.net
www.wtsevents.net

Body:
Hi Bob,
Sorry I missed you today.  I have attached two pictures.  One picture is 
what we are kind of looking for.  The other is one of the locations.  
This attached location is next to zacs bay by Jones Beach.  I am looking

tomorrow.  Thank you,
Mike

Plainview, NY 11803

                     LOSS OR DAMAGE INSTRUCTIONS

All merchandise in this shipment was turned over to the carrier in GOOD
CONDITION.  The following rules must be honored so your interests and
those of Wenger Corporation are protected.  THIS IS MANDATORY SHOULD
A FREIGHT CLAIM BE NECESSARY!

1. COUNT the number of cartons and compare with the freight bill.
   CHECK FOR YOUR ADDRESS on the outside of all cartons.

2. If there is a SHORTAGE, or DAMAGE (tears, rips, holes, crushed
   or creased), you MUST have the truck driver make a DAMAGE NOTATION
   or SHORTAGE NOTATION on all copies of the FREIGHT BILL AT THE
   TIME OF DELIVERY.

3. If any CONCEALED DAMAGE is discovered, you MUST call Wenger
   Corporation immediately.

4. DO NOT MOVE damaged merchandise from your receiving area until after
   the inspection has been made.  SAVE THE CARTONING MATERIAL from the
   damaged unit(s) for the inspection.

5. DO NOT RETURN damaged goods to our factory unless authorized to do so
   by the freight company or Wenger Corporation.

6. DO NOT FILE a freight claim unless AUTHORIZED BY WENGER CORPORATION.

Body:

    You may have already gotten the date but I wanted to get it all into an email!

We would like to keep the same red, white and blue up lighting on the Memorial wall, tent lighting, podium spot lights, vocalist spot, pathway lighting for safety, lighting on the American Flag etc.   Pretty much the same as the past few years. Body:
I hope you're doing well. I just wanted to let you know about an end of month promo that we have going on with our wireless qolorpoint units. I apologize for the last minute information with only 2 days left on this promo. We are offering a 15% discount on these cases of 6 units. Also, we have leasing options with this product as well. This option allows you to purchase the fixtures with no money down and no monthly payment for up to 12 weeks. Please let me know if you're interested and I'd be happy to get you going!

Thanks
Mike

 Hi Bobby,

    You may have already gotten the date but I wanted to get it all into an email!

          This yearâ€™s 9/11 Memorial is scheduled to be held Thursday, September 6, 2018 at 7PM at TOBAY Beach.   We would like to keep the same red, white and blue up lighting on the Memorial wall, tent lighting, podium spot lights, vocalist spot, pathway lighting for safety, lighting on the American Flag etc.   Pretty much the same as the past few years.    Thanks!


Sharon A. Betz
Town of Oyster Bay
Department of Community and Youth Services
Cultural and Performing Arts Division, Director
977 Hicksville Road
Massapequa, NY 11758
516.797.7933
516.797.7919 (FAX)

Body:

We would love to set up a demo. We are from LI but currently live in
Houston, TX. We will be on Long Island on 8/30 and can meet at THC on 8/30
or 8/31 for a demo. Can you please send us a few samples? That would be a
lot of help!

Thanks for reaching out, I have attached the signed contract.

Thanks again,

Phil Luongo
516-859-8862

On Thu, Aug 2, 2018 at 11:11 AM, Bobby <bob@brilliancepro.com> wrote:

> Hi Phillip:  My name is Mary Ellen and I work here in the office at
> Brilliance.  While I was out I see you worked with Bob for your
> wedding on September 2nd.  Being you picked Package #4 do you have an idea
> of what colors you would like the room, or do you want to

> help you in any way.
>
> Mary Ellen

Subject: Re: Price Sheet
Body:
Hi Bobby,

I am Pearce Farnum's fiancé. I just wanted to follow up on the pricing you
gave him, as it doesn't provide much detail. I am looking to do string
lighting across the dance floor. I know you suggested the up lighting in
the windows. Do you guys do any ala carte options? I really don't need all
the bells and whistles, I really just want up lighting and a spotlight. We
are trying to be budget friendly! Just wanted to inquire. Also, my sister
used you for her wedding back in 2014. Do you offer any "returning
customer" discounts or referral discounts?

Thank you,
Brittany McMahon

Subject: Fwd: 2Semper Fi
Body:
SEMPER     FI
    
    
    
 
    
    
 

    
    
    
    
 
    
If     you haven't already seen this, read on:
    
    
    
 
    
    
    
    
    
    
 

    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
 
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
      
      
        
          
          
          
 
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          

The           ACLU recently closed it's only office in Wyoming (Cheyenne) in           recognition of the fact that they           are not welcome here; no kidding, this was in the Laramie           newspaper a couple days ago.

          
          
          

 

          
          
          
          

USMC           vs the ACLU  

          
          
          
 

          
          
          
          

OOH           RAH !!! - "SEMPER FI"            

          
          
          

 

          
          
          
          
THIS NEEDS TO GO AROUND THE           USA MANY TIMES SO KEEP IT GOING!

          
          
          
          



          
          
          
          

If           you look closely at the picture above, you will note that all the           Marines pictured are bowing their heads.  That's because they're           praying.  This incident took place at a recent ceremony honoring           the birthday of the corps, and it has the ACLU up in arms.            
"These           are federal employees," says Lucius Traveler, a spokesman for the           ACLU, "on 
federal           property and on federal time... 

          
          
          
 

          
          
          
For them to pray is clearly an           establishment of religion, and we must nip this in the bud           immediately."             

          
          
          

 

          
          
          
          
When asked about the ACLU's           charges, 
Colonel           Jack Fessender, speaking for the Commandant of the Corps           said, 

"F*** the ACLU, GOD           Bless Our Warriors.  
Send           the ACLU to Afghanistan and then watch those SONS OF BITCHES           pray." 

          
          
          
          

Please           send this to people you know so everyone will know how stupid the ACLU           is getting in trying to remove GOD from everything and every place in           America.

          
          
          

 

          
          
          
          
May God Bless           America, 

          
          
          
          
One Nation Under           GOD!

What's wrong with           the picture?  
  
ABSOLUTELY           NOTHING!

Subject: Fwd: To Be 8 Again
Body:
Sent from my iPad


> 
> 
> 
> To Be 8 again!
> 
> A man was sitting on the edge of the bed, watching his wife, who was looking at herself in the mirror. Since her birthday was not far off, he asked what she'd like to have for her birthday.
> 
> 'I'd like to be eight again', she replied, still looking in the mirror.
> 
> On the morning of her birthday, he arose early, made her a nice big bowl of Coco Pops, and then took her to Adventure World theme park. What a day! He put her on every ride in the park; the Death Slide, the Wall of Fear, the Screaming Roller Coaster, everything there was.
> 
> Five hours later they staggered out of the theme park. Her head was reeling and her stomach felt upside down. He then took her to a McDonald's where he ordered her a Happy Meal with extra fries and a chocolate shake.
> 
> Then it was off to a movie, popcorn, a soda pop, and her favorite candy, M&M's. What a fabulous adventure!
> 
> Finally she wobbled home with her husband and collapsed into bed exhausted.
> 
> He leaned over his wife with a big smile and lovingly asked, 'Well Dear, what was it like being eight again'?
> 
> Her eyes slowly opened and her expression suddenly changed.
> 
> 'I meant my dress size, you f#**%g! retard!!!!'
> 
> The moral of the story:   Even when a man is listening, he is gonna get it wrong.
> 
> SEND THIS TO ALL THE MEN & WOMEN WHO NEED A LAUGH.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
Label: IMPORTANT,CATEGORY_PERSONAL,INBOX,UNREAD

Subject: Fwd: Break Up the NFL’s Corrupt Dem Monopoly
Body:
After we were talking I saw this in my in box from last Sept.  Didn't read until today.











Break Up the NFL’s Corrupt Dem Monopoly
Why it’s high time for the NFL to take a knee.
September 26, 2017 
Daniel Greenfield



Daniel Greenfield, a Shillman Journalism Fellow at the Freedom Center, is an investigative journalist and writer focusing on the radical left and Islamic terrorism.
An Army recruit starts off with a salary under $20,000. Thousands of active duty military personnel are on food stamps. Millions of veterans rely on them to feed their families and themselves.
That’s how we treat the best of us. Here’s how we treat the worst of us.
An NFL rookie’s minimum salary is $465,000. And the majority of NFL players are usually bankrupt a few years after retirement because they blew through most of their money. Dozensof NFL players are arrested every year on charges ranging from murder to rape to animal abuse.
2017 was a banner year for the NFL with three times as many arrests as last year.
Along with the usual drunk driving and disorderly conduct arrests, there were 7 arrests for assault/battery, 6 for drugs and 5 for domestic violence.
The Seattle Seahawks announced that they weren’t going to “participate in the national anthem” because of the “injustice that has plagued people of color in this country”. While they lost that game, they are one of the top ranked teams in arrests. Alongside the Los Angeles Rams, the Green Bay Packers and the New York Jets, all of whom showed some solidarity with the anti-American protests, these top NFL criminal teams have racked up arrests for domestic violence, drugs, DUI and assault and battery.
Is it any wonder they think the justice system is unfair? They’re criminals.
Broncos linebacker Brandon Marshall was one of the early players to reject the Anthem. The Broncos supported his actions. As his teams have supported him during nine domestic violence accusations.  
Did any of the women he stabbed, punched or choked have any choice about taking a knee?
It’s no wonder that so many of the NFL’s millionaire scumbags are eager to join Colin Kaepernick’s protests against the justice system by degrading our anthem.
It’s because they’re criminals.  
And it’s no wonder that the NFL stands behind its thugs. If a team can shrug at a 6’4 man beating a woman, what’s a little anti-American tantrum by a prize property that makes them millions of dollars?
The only question is why are the rest of us subsidizing it?
NFL teams loot millions from taxpayers to fund their stadiums. The Seahawks have a point about injustice. Andthe injustice is that taxpayers had to spend $390 million on their stadium.
Who will let Washington taxpayers take a knee and opt out of being exploited by the Seahawks?
Ten New Orleans Saints players sat out the anthem. New Orleans Saints coach Sean Payton expressed pride in the players who rejected the United States of America. The Saints not only enjoy a stadium paid for by a billion in taxpayer money in a city with one of the highest poverty rates in the country, but are exemptfrom sales tax. And receive millions every year in “inducement payments” to stay put.
Sweetheart deals like these are not uncommon. The NFL comes with a pass on property taxes (those are for little people) and taxes in general. Until 2015, the NFL was a non-profit. "Professional football leagues" was actually inserted into the Internal Revenue Code to provide a special non-profit status. NFL commissioner Roger Goodell got paid $44 million in one year. That made him the highest paid non-profit exec in the country.
The entire NFL is an illegal trust. It’s a monopoly that was illegally legalized by Congress.
That monopoly allows the NFL and its teams to cash in on television licensing and team gear. After the NFL uses its illegal monopoly to rip off broadcasters, ESPN rips off cable subscribers.
ESPN pays the NFL almost $2 billion a year. Even if you don’t watch ESPN, you’re paying $9 a month for it because of yet another illegal monopoly. If you subscribe to cable or live in a major city, the odds are good that your pocket is being picked by the millionaire racists “taking a knee” against America.





But the monopolies are dying.
ESPN is bleeding subscribers. The NFL’s anti-American turn is alienating fans. And cable is collapsing.
The NFL is built on government taking money from people and giving it to the industry. Its leftward tilt isn’t an accident. It’s a calculated move. Who are the folks most likely to bail out an industry? They’re on the left. Not the right. If your monopoly is dying, it’s time to go left and hate America.
Anthem bashing is popular with the left. And it’s very popular with the social justice bloggers who increasingly dominate sports journalism, and not just on ESPN. Hating America will score points with the left. It’ll buy the NFL more protectionism from the media and the 2020 Democrats.
The only question is why do we need the NFL?
Once upon a time there was a football free market. Multiple leagues competed with each other. And the NFL was just one of many. The NFL-AFL merger created a monster monopoly that has worked to crush any independent league through its control over broadcasting and venues.
That's what happened with the United States Football League which won an anti-trust court case against the NFL, but was forced under anyway.
The man at the center of the fight against the NFL was New Jersey Generals owner Donald Trump.
The illegal monopoly that created the NFL was the work of Senator Russell Long, the son of radical criminal Dem kingpin Huey Long, who illegally took over his father’s Senate seat (previously held by his mother) and spent almost four decades in the Senate with no qualification except his last name.
The NFL got a monopoly in exchange for New Orleans getting a franchise.
Congressman Hale Boggs, the corrupt Louisiana Dem boss who went to war with the FBI, got it through in the House by appealing, “The Republicans are out to get me. I need this to save me."
And Boggs held things up until he got assurances from the NFL commissioner that the franchise was in.
That’s the corrupt Democrat deal that created the NFL monopoly. Of course the NFL thinks the justice system is unfair. It was created by a crime and it’s full of criminals.
Before the anthem protests, the NFL was just one of the corrupt legacies of Democrat rule. It’s a reminder of the fact that social justice politics, whether it’s Obama’s “You Didn’t Build That” or Huey Long’s “Share Our Wealth”, is nothing more than organized thievery from the working class.
But the NFL is no longer just a corrupt monopoly. Instead it’s becoming a radical anti-American organization that uses its taxpayer-subsidized stadiums and monopoly broadcasting rights to spread hatred toward this country and disrespect to the soldiers who fought and died for it.
America could have tolerated the NFL’s corrupt thievery. But there’s no way Americans should be subsidizing this diseased leftover of Democrat corruption when it spews hate at the United States.
It’s time for the NFL’s anti-trust exemption to go the way of Ma Bell.
Break up the corrupt Democrat monopoly of the NFL and demolish the barriers to the formation of independent leagues by taking on the NFL, ESPN and its broadcasting partners in crime.
It’s time for the NFL to take a knee and for the free market to rise.
Football must become an American sport again.
Label: IMPORTANT,CATEGORY_PERSONAL,INBOX,UNREAD

Subject: Hofstra 27, 28, 29
Body:
Hey Bob,


Here is what we did last year. Stage comes in Sept 27th, gig is the 29th. We have leeway to do what we want, so if your guys want to design something else that's ok. I though last year looked awesome as is so I'm fine with it either way. 

Lighting



Air Package
3 - 30ft truss
12 - Martin Mac Aura
8 - Martin Mac Profile
6 - Vizi Beams
2 - Molefay 8 bulb
2 - Molefay 4 bulb
4 - Martin AtomicStrobes
2 - Martin 24/7 Hazers
8 - Source 4 Parcans
 
Floor Package
2 - 5ft 12" boxtruss on base plate (applied)
2 - 8ft 12" boxtruss on base plate (applied)
6 - Vizi Beams 
8 - Led inside the boxtruss
 
1 - Avolite Pearl TigerConsole

 
Thanks,
Eric

Rainbow Sound
80 Rome Street
Farmingdale NY 11735
www.rainbowsound.net
631.752.8869 Office
631.752.8874 Fax

Subject: Pitch you with NEW Lighting 1400W Strobe IP65 Waterproof
Body:
Dear Bob Richards,

I know you are busy, so please allow me to get straight to the point.

I want to pitch you with our NEW product Aurora 1400 Strobe Lighting IP65.
After reaching your product line for like 40 minutes, I believe we can
definitely make you more money.

Here is the function of our item( see, I don't want to waste your time.)
[image: Aurora 1400.png]

1. 192pcs White LED, flow effect in 8 segments
2. 640pcs RGB LED, each one can be individually controlled, create video
effect
3. IP65 waterproof
4. Support DMX and Art-Net Control
5. Use Marco to program
6. Built-in color effect Marco function
7. Total 1400W Power

8. All use waterproof plug

Let's keep the ball rolling if you are interested.

*Thanks for your time.*
Kiki
Product Consultant

Subject: RE: FREE's 2018 Celebration of Life Gala
Body:
Good afternoon MaryEllen and Bob,

I just wanted to follow up from our conversation last week. I have a walkthrough with Bob at The Mansion at Oyster Bay set up for Sept 10th at 10:30 am.

I was hoping you could send me some pricing prior to then. Some of the services we discussed were:

·         stage and microphone

·         teleprompting

·         large screen TVs to play video and event journal (at least 2)

·         iPads on all of the tables to also display the event journal (we typically have 25-30 tables and would need at least 2 iPads per table)

Please let me know if any of these services are unavailable so I can continue to reach out to other vendors. And if you can send me over some pricing that would be very helpful.

Thank you,

Sara Guando
Event and Fund Development Coordinator
Family Residences and Essential Enterprises, Inc. (FREE)
516-870-1600 ext. 1869
191 Bethpage Sweet Hollow Road
Old Bethpage, NY 11804

Coach & “Golden Richards” pls confirm you received this email


Sent from my iPhone

Begin forwarded message:

> From: Dennis McCoy <dennismccoy77@yahoo.com>
> Date: September 3, 2018 at 1:04:07 PM EDT
> To: Frank Saracino <fjsaracino58@verizon.net>, pedro831@optonline.net, diaanderson50@gmail.com, aanders3@optonline.net, Dennis White McCoy <dennismccoy77@yahoo.com>, Paul James Ostling <paul.ostling@pauljostling.com>

> 
> Good afternoon Rams:
> 
> Hope you are enjoying the last weeks of summer..
> 
> We have started the process and things are progressing - we are ready to move forward and need your help. Thank you in advance for agreeing to participate in this wonderful effort.
> 
> Please see email crafted by Anthony (Tony) Caiazza “63” A great guy and very passionate about his close friend & taking on this worthwhile endeavor to celebrate Coach John Boyle dedication to WTC High School and his many years of coaching football.
> 
> He has outlined in detail his reasons why many have a need to get on board.. He mentions the pledges for financial help & listed some of the plans and ideas for the last home game of October 27, 2018. (All subject to approvals).

> 1 PM at the Harvest Diner.

Subject: Fwd: Coach John Boyle Memorial Meeting / Update September 10 at 1 pm
Body:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dennis McCoy <dennismccoy77@yahoo.com>
Date: Thu, Sep 6, 2018 at 9:01 AM
Subject: Coach John Boyle Memorial Meeting / Update September 10 at 1 pm
To: <pedro831@optonline.net>, <diaanderson50@gmail.com>, <
aanders3@optonline.net>, Paul James Ostling <paul.ostling@pauljostling.com>,
Frank Saracino <fjsaracino58@verizon.net>, Tony Caiazza <
acaiazza1958@gmail.com>, <fjsaracino58@gmail.com>
Cc: Snook Goldberger <michael_goldberger@brown.edu>


Great News!

The Coach John Boyle Memorial is well on its way..

Congratulations to our leader Tony Caiazza # 63 for his non-stop efforts to
get this worthwhile effort of the ground in record time... As many of you
know he is very detailed and passionate as Coach was his best friend. This
is really now becoming an alumni event from all classmates & athletes from
WTC.

So far, we have a great response to get this completed on such a short
timeframe.
We have pledges of 3k and others waiting to make their checks out - It is
such a wonderful opportunity to be able to part of this WTC community
effort.
Thanks in advance for coming on board.

Some updates & Highlights:

We have approval from the school board for the bronze Ram

We have a lawyer & former WTC Ram football player agreed to fund & is in
process of setting up a separate corporation for this effort. We will be
ready to accept checks & how to make it payable & hopefully by this coming
Tuesday.

At our meeting- We will have an agenda & discuss some of the plans for the
last home game of the season Saturday, October 27th.

Also joining our committee Coach Bob Gorman and Coach Ralph Capozzi - look
forward to seeing you.

The meeting will be 1 PM at the Harvest Diner on Old Country Rd. Westbury

We will share the good news & details and have an agenda for next steps and
how you can assist.

Thank you again - Go Rams!

“Build it and they will come”

Dennis “77”




Sent from my iPhone
Label: IMPORTANT,CATEGORY_PERSONAL,INBOX,UNREAD

Subject: Who took my money?
Body:
Sent from my iPad


> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>>> WHO TOOK MY MONEY?
>>>  
>>> Interesting read  
>>> 
>>> LET�S SEE WHO TOOK MY MONEY????   
>>> 
>>> Actually, Democrat President Kennedy and   Sergeant Shriver were the first ones to  misuse the Social Security account.  They used Social Security funds to start the  Peace Corps.  Not the first or last time our   money has been taken from American  citizens and given to foreign nations.   
>>> 
>>> Things every US citizen should know and   remember about Social Security and  changes made.   
>>> 
>>> A History Lesson on Your Social Security   Card.  Just in case some of you young  whippersnappers (& some older ones)   didn't know this.  It's easy to check out, if   you don't believe it.  Be sure and show it to your family and friends.  They need a little history lesson on what's what and it   doesn't matter whether you are Democrat or Republican.   
>>> 
>>> Facts are Facts.   
>>> 
>>> Social Security Cards up until the 1980s   expressly stated the number and card were not to be used for identification   purposes.  Since nearly everyone in the United States now has a number, it   became convenient to use it anyway and the message,       NOT FOR IDENTIFICATION, was removed.
>>> 
>>> Franklin Roosevelt, a Democrat, introduced the Social Security (FICA)       Program.   
>>> 
>>> He promised;   
>>> 1.) That participation in the Program   would be completely voluntary.   
>>> 
>>> No longer Voluntary   
>>> 
>>> 2.) That the participants would only have to pay 1% of the first $1,400 of their annual Incomes into the Program.   
>>>     
>>> Now 7.65% on the first $90,000.   
>>> 
>>> 3) That the money the participants elected   to put into the Program would be deductible from their income for tax purposes each       year.   
>>> 
>>> No longer tax deductible   
>>> 
>>> 4.) That the money the participants put       into the independent 'Trust Fund' rather than into the general operating fund,       and therefore, would only be used to       fund the Social Security Retirement    Program, and no other Government       program.   
>>> 
>>> Under Democrat President Johnson ,   the money was moved to the General       Fund and spent.   
>>> 
>>> 5.) That the annuity payments to the retirees would never be taxed as income.   
>>> 
>>> Under Democrats Clinton & Gore Up to   85% of your Social Security can be taxed.   
>>> 
>>> Since many of us have paid into FICA for       years and are now receiving a Social Security check every month and then   finding that we are getting taxed on 85% of the money we paid to the Federal       government to 'put away' -- you may be       interested in the following:   
>>> 
>>> Q: Which Political Party took Social       Security from the independent 'Trust       Fund' and put it into the general fund so   that Congress could spend it?   
>>> 
>>> A: It was Lyndon Johnson and the   democratically controlled House and   
>>> Senate.   
>>> 
>>> Q: Which Political Party eliminated the       income tax deduction for Social   Security (FICA) withholding?  
>>> 
>>> A: The Democrat Party.      
>>>  
>>> Q: Which Political Party started taxing       Social Security annuities?   
>>> 
>>> A: The Democratic Party, with Al Gore       casting the 'tie-breaking' deciding vote   as President of the Senate, while he   was Vice president of the U.S. 
>>> 
>>> Q: Which Political Party decided to start   giving annuity payments to immigrants?
>>>  
>>> A: That's right! Jimmy Carter and the   Democratic Party. Immigrants moved into this country, and at age 65, began to receive Social Security payments!  The Democrat Party gave these payments to them, even though they never paid a dime into it!
>>> 
>>> Then, after violating the original contract       (FICA), the Democrats turn around and      tell you that the Republicans want to take your Social Security away!   
>>> 
>>> And the worst part about it is uninformed   citizens believe it!   
>>> 
>>> If enough people receive this, maybe a   seed of awareness will be planted and maybe changes will evolve.   
>>> 
>>> But it's worth a try.   
>>> 
>>> How many people can YOU send this to?   
>>> 
>>> Actions speak louder than bumper stickers.   
>>> 
>>> PLEASE DO KEEP THIS ONE ROLLING ACROSS THE COUNTRY.
>>>  
>>> HOPEFULLY IT WILL OPEN A FEW EYES!!!
>>>  
>>>  
>>> __._,_.___
>>> Posted by: a <f846@aol.com>
>>> Reply via web post 	•	Reply to sender 	•	Reply to group 	•	Start a New Topic 	•	Messages in this topic (1)

Subject: Fwd: : FISHING
Body:
> 
>> 
>> 
>>> 
>>>  
>>> The king wanted to go fishing, and he asked the royal weather forecaster for the forecast for the next few hours.
>>>  
>>> The palace meteorologist assured him that it was clear and a perfect day for fishing. So the king and the queen went fishing.
>>>  
>>> On the way he met a man with a fishing pole riding on a donkey, and he asked the man if the fish were biting. The fisherman said, "Your  Majesty, you should return to the palace!  In just a short time I expect a huge rain storm.
>>>  
>>> “The king replied: "I hold the palace meteorologist in high regard.  He is an educated and experienced professional. Besides, I pay him very high wages.  He gave me a very different forecast. I trust him.
>>>  
>>> “So the king and queen continued on their way. However, in a short time a torrential rain fell from the sky.  The King and Queen were totally soaked. Furious, the king returned to the palace and gave the order to fire the meteorologist.
>>>  
>>> Then he summoned the fisherman and offered him the prestigious position of royal forecaster.
>>>  
>>> The fisherman said, "Your Majesty, I do not know anything about forecasting.  I obtain my information from my donkey.  If I see my donkey's ears drooping, it means with certainty that...it will rain.
>>>  
>>>  
>>> "   So the king hired the donkey. And thus began the practice of hiring dumb asses to work in influential positions of government. The practice is unbroken to this date.  Thus, the democrat party symbol was born!
Label: IMPORTANT,CATEGORY_PERSONAL,INBOX,UNREAD

Subject: Fwd: J'ouvert
Body:
Please send this to Mr. Dominic
>> 
>> 
>> 
>> 
>> ----- 
>>  
>> 
>>  
>>  
>> Twas the night before J'ouvert, and all through the hood,
>> a riot was forming, things didn't look good.
>>  
>> The speakers were hung out the windows with care
>> with hopes that the "5-0" would not be called there.
>>  
>> Three victims were robbed, guns were put to their heads,
>> they was robbed by a brotha wearing blue paint with dreads.
>>  
>> And my boo in her spandex, and me in my gear
>> had just settled down with a cold Red Stripe beer.
>>  
>> When up on my roof there arose such a ruckus,
>> We thought it was whitey, coming down here to fvck us.
>>  
>> I ran to the stairwell, with jammy in hand,
>> but it was only Saint Rasta, and his loud steel drum band.
>>  
>> I went back to my crib, just a mindin my bidnizz,
>> Then I lit up a spliff and cracked open a guiness.
>>  
>> When suddenly there came a loud knock on my door,
>> man I swore it was Quaneesha, our local crack whore.
>>  
>> What a pleasant surprise, it was a long dreaded Hatian,
>> and he lifted my soul with a warm invitation ...
>>  
>> "Come up to dee roof, Where de fun never stops,
>> we'll smoke up all the ganga and throw rocks at the cops."
>>  
>> So I grabbed me a bottle, full of rice, hops and barley
>> and proceeded upstairs to dance to Bob Marley.
>>  
>> The rastas were zooted, as high as a kite
>> while the murder and mayhem went on through the night.
>>  
>> I passed on a joint to my super named Hector,
>> then I threw me a brick at a bypassing sector.
>>  
>> The lawlessness ruled, twas was criminal's heaven,
>> till we hit a patrol car assigned to the six-seven.
>>  
>> We were gonna pay dearly for harassing "the man",
>> because twenty white devils poured out of a van.
>>  
>> The cops was in riot gear, dressed like Mike Richter,
>> about to kick ass on a 75 Victor.
>>  
>> They came up to the roof, acting violent and mean
>> and they buss up my homeboy, named Jean Claude St. Jean.
>>  
>> They told me to drop my Bacardi and cola,
>> and went upside my head with a large cocobola.
>>  
>> The handcuffs was flyin' what a terrible sight,
>> Happy J'Ouvert to all, in "da bookins" tonight.
>> 
>>
Label: IMPORTANT,CATEGORY_PERSONAL,INBOX,UNREAD

Subject: ACDS event at Heritage
Body:
Hey, are you still the lighting vendor at Heritage? I haven’t done any corporates since they switched hands. 

We’re doing the ACDS fundraising event again this year on October 20 and I’ll need some support from you again.

Please let me know if you’re still in there and I’ll discuss the details with you.

Thanks,
Dave

Have you seen our demo reel? 
https://vimeo.com/199454561 <https://vimeo.com/199454561>

Subject: Re: ACDS event at Heritage
Body:
Great, I figured as much. So it will be similar to last year but I need a little more. Mike and I will both be out of town on other assignments so I have my other team handling this. They’re well seasoned, but I don’t want them to worry about the lighting or displays. 

Date: 10/20
Event: ACDS Annual Fundraising Gala
Time: Cocktails 7, Ballroom doors 8 - 12
Location: Heritage Bethpage

Here’s what I need you to quote on:

2x 70” displays (or the largest that you own)
Box truss stands with black scrims
HD cabling up to video village - we will supply you with a single SDI feed. You’ll run out to your displays from there
Focused lighting on podium.
Last year we only had control over the par cans which was limiting. Can we use those and also have you aim/focus/color balance the moveable heads as well?
Tech to run lights for event
Last year we controlled lighting, but I would don’t want my director to worry about that this year

Last year you charged $500. I realize this will be more so let me know so I can run it by the client.

Thanks,
Dave

Subject: Re: ACDS event at Heritage
Body:
I know Fridays are busy for you. Do you think you can get me $ on Monday? They’re itching to lock this all up.

Thanks,
Dave

> On Sep 12, 2018, at 2:19 PM, Robert Richards <bob@brilliancepro.com> wrote:
> 
> Got it. Thanks
> 
> Sent from my iPhone
> 
> On Sep 12, 2018, at 2:05 PM, David Goldberg <worx@waterworx.com <mailto:worx@waterworx.com>> wrote:
> 
>> Great, I figured as much. So it will be similar to last year but I need a little more. Mike and I will both be out of town on other assignments so I have my other team handling this. They’re well seasoned, but I don’t want them to worry about the lighting or displays. 
>> 
>> Date: 10/20
>> Event: ACDS Annual Fundraising Gala
>> Time: Cocktails 7, Ballroom doors 8 - 12
>> Location: Heritage Bethpage
>> 
>> Here’s what I need you to quote on:
>> 
>> 2x 70” displays (or the largest that you own)
>> Box truss stands with black scrims
>> HD cabling up to video village - we will supply you with a single SDI feed. You’ll run out to your displays from there
>> Focused lighting on podium.
>> Last year we only had control over the par cans which was limiting. Can we use those and also have you aim/focus/color balance the moveable heads as well?
>> Tech to run lights for event
>> Last year we controlled lighting, but I would don’t want my director to worry about that this year
>> 
>> Last year you charged $500. I realize this will be more so let me know so I can run it by the client.
>> 
>> Thanks,
>> Dave
>>

Subject: RE: Gala
Body:
Good afternoon,

Hoping this email finds you well. I reviewed the production proposal that was sent over and we had a few questions/possible edits to make.

1. We would like to ensure that the proposal sent over includes the live streaming to the TVs in the room, as well as a recording, of the program.

2. We would like to put a cityscape lighting on the back walls (opposite the TV walls) and were wondering if you had anything similar to these:
https://www.stagelightingstore.com/apollo-printscenic-gobos/127334-printscenic-plastic-gobo-me6056-windy-city-skyline?utm_source=google&utm_medium=base&utm_campaign=products&leadsource=14&gclid=Cj0KCQjwof3cBRD9ARIsAP8x70N0x7m2Uku4eWnpjr470goqlHmgn4SElgPv8WYd0Mlzxuut3Z31WzYaAnxOEALw_wcB

https://www.stagelightingstore.com/apollo-sun/132506-apollo-metal-gobo-1230-big-city-lights?utm_source=google&utm_medium=base&utm_campaign=products&leadsource=14&gclid=Cj0KCQjwof3cBRD9ARIsAP8x70MUcGCllHMXLHj16iYlHd_iuIrLKXRfT9J5iXs_u73d2GbuV7EEvYUaAjyNEALw_wcB

https://www.pnta.com/expendables/gobos/steel/rosco/rosco-79023-city-lights-2-steel-pattern/?utm_source=google&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=shopping&cid=1537334800&aid=58995923952&keyword=rosco+79023+city+lights+2+steel+pattern+gobos+%7C+pnta&kid=435680333218&gclid=Cj0KCQjwof3cBRD9ARIsAP8x70ObViPeURpwqqNKG-PhoRf-1likjH2PjzrCDc0JhlOSdLMVi3YyAEMaAiGKEALw_wcB&ad=291960245038

Or, if inserts were purchased, you could facilitate this?

3. We talked about stage size and set up but we didn't talk about stage lighting and I was wondering what this proposal includes, if anything.

4. Lastly, we were planning on using the venue's sound system during cocktail hour but did want to know (since you are so familiar with the venue) if you felt additional sound or lighting support was needed on the rooftop.

Thank you for your help. I'm looking forward to getting this contract back to you as soon as we are able to clear up these questions.

Sara Guando
Event and Fund Development Coordinator
Family Residences and Essential Enterprises, Inc. (FREE)
516-870-1600 ext. 1869
191 Bethpage Sweet Hollow Road
Old Bethpage, NY 11804
familyres.org






-----Original Message-----
From: Bobby [mailto:bob@brilliancepro.com]
Sent: Tuesday, September 11, 2018 3:33 PM
To: Sara Guando <Sguando01@familyres.org>
Subject: Gala

Hi Sara:  I was just going through e-mails and I am not sure if the Proposal I sent you yesterday actually went.  Please accept my apology as we are having trouble with our computer system so  I sent you a duplicate.  If you have any questions please call Bob or myself.

Mary Ellen

Subject: Fwd: intro - Jackie & Bill
Body:
LMK if anything is problematic?
Here are the sponsors notes for the AV requirements. 


BillBradyphotography
bill@billbradyphotography.com
<http://www.billbradyphotography.com>
917-536-2689

> Begin forwarded message:
> 
> From: Jackie DeFlorio <Jackie.Thompson13@AlticeUSA.com>
> Subject: RE: intro - Jackie & Bill
> Date: September 19, 2018 at 3:25:17 PM EDT
> To: BillBradyphotography <bill@billbradyphotography.com>, ciara pettaway <cpet25@gmail.com>
> Cc: Kristy Uvena <Kristy.Uvena@AlticeUSA.com>
> 
> Hi Bill,
>  
> So nice to meet you!
>  
> I will definitely try to get you some materials by the end of this week but we won’t know who our finalists for a competition we’re running are until next week, and they may or may not have presentations to go along with their pitch during our 11am-12pm time slot. I will do my best to get you everything needed asap!!!
>  
> Here’s a quick overview of AV materials we’ll most likely need:
>  
> -          11am-12pm Innovation Challenge Presentation
> o    Up to 3 individual PPTs, under 10 slides each
> o    BHV Demo – can we do a live feed from an iPad or would a PPT be better?
> o    Three lapel mics for judges; one lapel mic for BHV product manager doing demo; two handheld mics for other presenters [Total: 4 lapel, 2 handheld]
> -          2-2:15pm Intro to Daymond
> o    Our SVP would like to have a video play while she is presenting but I have a feeling PPT may work best here. If I provide a PPT, do you have a clicker that I can use to move through the presentation as she’s speaking?
> o    One podium with mic, if possible. Handheld mic otherwise.
>  
> Do you foresee any issues with any of this?
>  
> Thanks so much!
> Jackie
>  
>  
> Jackie DeFlorio
> Altice Business
> Marketing Manager – Events & Communications
>  
> O: 516.803.6410│M: 516.455.0814
> 1111 Stewart Avenue│Bethpage, NY 11714 
> 
>  
>  
>

> Cc: Jackie DeFlorio <Jackie.Thompson13@AlticeUSA.com <mailto:Jackie.Thompson13@AlticeUSA.com>>
> Subject: Re: intro - Jackie & Bill
>  
> [External Email]
> Hello Jackie, I understand you have some video/powerpoint materials you wish to run during your presentation. 
> We can load your stuff up via a flash drive. Aspect ration is 16 x 9. 
> If you are using video please do not imbed it into powerpoint presentation. It tends to crash and freeze. Instead
> Please send Powerpoint without video and video separately. Please give me a call to discuss but it’s pretty straight forward. Also
> If I can your your materials end of the week we can load them to see if there are any issues
>  
> Bill
>  
> BillBradyphotography
> bill@billbradyphotography.com <mailto:bill@billbradyphotography.com>

Subject: SE-011-18 Surplus Recycling Trucks - Bid Documents Available
Body:
Attached please find notification a bid that may be of interest to your company. The Town is selling surplus Recycling Trucks.
If you would like a copy of the bid package listed in the attached Legal Notice please reply to this e-mail with the following information

Company Name
Mailing Address
Phone Number
Fax Number
Contact Person

If you are not the correct person to receive this e-mail, please forward to the appropriate person and notify me of the correct contact person and e-mail address for bid related materials.

A complete list of bids currently available is on our website
http://oysterbaytown.com/doing-business-with-the-town/

Thanks,
Jaime

General Services/Purchasing
74 Audrey Avenue, 4th floor
Oyster Bay, NY 11771
516-624-6116
